Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:shut down
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:Create instructions on how to [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT].
Answer Sentence:Create instructions on how to [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT].
Temp:0.8
Length:500

Create instructions on how to shut down the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

To shutdown the Vedere Vessel Management Software:
1. Login to your account at www.vedere.com.
2. Click on the “Vessels” tab on the top menu bar.
3. Click on the “Vedere Vessel Management Software” tab at the top of the page.
4. Click on the “Shutdown VVM” button near the bottom of the page.

Length:500

Create instructions on how to reset the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software. Click on the "Settings" button. Click on the "Reset" button. Select the desired settings. Click on the "Reset" button.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software

Title Sentence:Create instructions on how to [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT].
Answer Sentence:Create instructions on how to [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT].
Temp:0.8
Length:500

Create instructions on how to wipe the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

1. Download the Vedere Vessel Management Software by clicking on the link below.

2. Once you have downloaded the software, open it and click on the "Vessel Manager" button.

3. On the "Vessel Manager" screen, click on the "Wipes" button.

4. On the "Wipes" screen, click on the " wipe hard drive " button.

5. On the " wipe hard drive " screen, enter your login credentials and click on the "start wiping" button.

Length:500

Create instructions on how to update the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software and sign in.

2. On the main menu, click on Update.

3. On the Update screen, enter your license key and click on Start Update.

4. The software will then update and show a message telling you when it is finished.

Answer Sentence:Create instructions on how to [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT].
Temp:0.8
Length:500

Create instructions on how to upgrade the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

1. Log into your Vedere Vessel Management account.

2. Click the “Software” tab and select the “Upgrades” drop-down menu.

3. Select the type of upgrade you want to perform and click the “Next” button.

4. Review the information presented and click the “Next” button again.

5. Follow the on-screen prompts to complete the upgrade process.

Create instructions on how to install the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

1. Go to the Vedere website and find the installation instructions for your specific product.

2. Follow the instructions to install the software.

3. Once the software is installed, open it and create a new account.

4. Fill out the account information, including your company name and contact information.

5. Select a subscription plan that suits your needs.

Answer Sentence:How do you [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT]?
Temp:0.8
Length:500

How do you upgrade the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

To upgrade the Vedere Vessel Management Software, you will first need to uninstall the old software. Once the old software is uninstalled, you can install the new software by entering the following URL into your web browser:

https://vedere.com/download/upgrade-software/

IMPORTANT: When you click on the "Download" button, you will be asked if you want to save the file to your computer. If you choose to save the file, make sure that you save it to a location on your computer where you can easily access it. Once you have downloaded the file, double-click on it to start the installation process.

How do you install the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

To install the Vedere Vessel Management Software, please follow these steps:

1. Download and install the software from our website.

2. Log into your account on our website.

3. Click on the "Install" button next to the software you would like to install.

4. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation process.

Answer Sentence:How do you [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT]?
Temp:0.8
Length:500

How do you add a new device to the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

To add a new device to the Vedere Vessel Management Software, complete the following steps:

1. Log in to the software.

2. Click on "Vessels" on the left-hand side of the screen.

3. Under "Devices," click on "Add Device."

4. Complete the fields in the "Device Information" form, and click "Submit."

5. The new device will now be visible under "Devices" on the left-hand side of the screen.

Answer Sentence:How do you [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT]?
Temp:0.8
Length:500

How do you add a new alarm setting to the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

To add a new alarm setting to the Vedere Vessel Management Software, open the vessel management software and click on "Alarms" in the left-hand navigation pane. In the "Alarms" window, click on the "+ Add Alarm" button. In the "Add Alarm" window, enter the name of the alarm and select a trigger type from the drop-down list. Click on the OK button to add the alarm setting to the vessel management software.

How do you enable the firefight status display with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

To enable the firefight status display, open the Vedere Vessel Management Software and navigate to Settings > Vessels. On the right-hand side, under "Display," select "Firefight Status."

How do you view the depth of the vessel with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

The depth of the vessel can be viewed by either navigating to the Vessel Information tab or entering the vessel's coordinates into the Vessel Search bar. The Vedere Vessel Management Software will then return a list of all vessels located within a certain range of the vessel's coordinates.

Length:500

Create instructions on how to add a new device to the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

Login to the Vedere Vessel Management Software. Click on "Tools" in the top left corner, and then click on "Device Management." In the Device Management window, click on the plus sign (+) to the right of the device you want to add. In the Add Device window, enter the following information: Name: The name of the device you are adding.

The name of the device you are adding. Type: The type of device you are adding. This can be a computer or device.

The type of device you are adding. This can be a computer or device. Location: The physical location of the device. This can be a server, room, or other location where the device exists.

The physical location of the device. This can be a server, room, or other location where the device exists. Status: The status of the device. This can be "Up," "Inactive," or "Died." Click on "Add." In the Devices window, you will now see your new device listed under "Devices Added."

Title Sentence:Create instructions on how to [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT].
Answer Sentence:Create instructions on how to [KEYWORD] the [PRODUCT].
Temp:0.8
Length:500

Create instructions on how to add a new alarm setting to the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

To add a new alarm setting to the Vedere Vessel Management Software:
1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.
2. Navigate to the "Alarms" tab.
3. Click on the "+ Alarm" button.
4. Select the type of alarm you want to create:
-Sound Alarm: This will create a sound alarm that will notify you when an event occurs.
-Motion Alarm: This will create a motion alarm that will notify you when an event occurs.
5. Enter the parameters for your alarm:
-Name: This is the name of your alarm.
-Description: This is a description of your alarm.
6. Click on the "Add" button.

Create instructions on how to diplay the Conning display with the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

1.Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software and select "Conning Display" from the main menu.

2.Select the "Conning Display Settings" tab and make sure that the "Show Conning Display" option is enabled.

3.Select the Conning Display icon from the toolbar and click on it to open the displayed window.

Length:500

Create instructions on how to enable the firefight status display with the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

To enable the firefight status display with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:

1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.
2. In the left pane, click Settings.
3. In the Settings window, under Navigation, click Firefight Status.
4. In the Firefight Status window, under Show On, select Your Vessel's Area below.
5. Click OK to save your changes.

Create instructions on how to view the depth of the vessel with the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

From the main menu, select "Vessel Management."


On the vessel overview screen, locate and click on the "Depth" tab. The depth of the vessel can be viewed in metres below sea level.

How does monitoring the propulsion devices work with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

The propulsion devices are monitored through the Vedere Vessel Management software. This software monitors the equipment and provides real-time feedback to the operators.

How does fire fighting work with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

The Vedere Vessel Management Software assists fire fighting by providing real-time information on vessel location, status, and operation. This information is used to route resources and coordinate efforts between firefighters and ship operators.

How does monitoring the batteries work with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

The Vedere Vessel Management software creates a battery monitor report that indicates how much power each battery bank is providing, how much battery capacity is remaining and when the batteries will need to be replaced.

Length:500

Explain to me how setting up the alarms works with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

The Vedere Vessel Management Software allows for the user to set up alarms for a variety of different events. These events could include the vessel reaching a pre-determined temperature, a CO2 level reaching a pre-determined level, or an alert being sent when the vessel reaches a pre-determined distance from shore.

Explain to me how the conning display works with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

The conning display is a feature that Vedere Vessel Management Software provides to help captains maintain situational awareness of their vessels. The conning display displays real-time vessel status, including vessel position, heading, speed, and other pertinent information.

Explain to me how monitoring the devices works with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

The Vedere Vessel Management Software is designed to monitor devices remotely. The software will send alerts if there are any issues with the device, and it can also keep track of the device's status.

Explain to me how adding new hardware works with the Vedere Vessel Management Software?

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Answer

The Vedere Vessel Management Software can be used to manage vessel operations and inventory through the use of a fleet management system. When new vessels are added to the fleet, information about the vessels must be entered into the fleet management system. The Vedere Vessel Management Software can then automatically update the vessel's information in the fleet management system.

Version:1
Title Sentence:How to solve [KEYWORD] for [PRODUCT] on a [BOAT].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: The [PRODUCT] has [KEYWORD].
Symptoms Sentence:What are the symptoms for the following problem: Vedere Vessel Management Software has a stuck device..
Instructions Sentence:Create a solution for the following problem: Vedere Vessel Management Software has a stuck device..
Temp:0.8
Length:500

How to solve a stuck device for Vedere Vessel Management Software on a Mercury.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Problem

Vedere Vessel Management Software has a stuck device.

Symptoms

The symptoms for the following problem: Vedere Vessel Management Software has a stuck device.. may include: an error message that says the device is "stuck," difficulties using the software, and problems with Vessel iView.

How to solve

If Vedere Vessel Management Software has a stuck device, you should try to restart it.

Temp:0.8
Length:500

How to solve how do i reset the software for Vedere Vessel Management Software on a Mercury.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Problem

The Vedere Vessel Management Software has a reset button that allows you to reset the software.

Symptoms

The symptoms for this problem would be that the user is not able to access their account or input data into the software.

How to solve

A possible solution to this problem could be to create a reset button within the software itself. This would allow users to reset the software without needing to contact Vedere.

How to solve a blank screen for Vedere Vessel Management Software on a Mercury.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Problem

The Vedere Vessel Management Software may have lost power and crashed, resulting in a blank screen.

Symptoms

The symptoms for this problem may include: a blank screen, no sound, or freezing.

How to solve

The Vedere Vessel Management Software may have lost power and crashed, resulting in a blank screen.
The user can reinstall the software from the manufacturer's website.

How to solve a blinking alarm for Vedere Vessel Management Software on a Mercury.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Problem

The Vedere Vessel Management Software has a blinking alarm that indicates an error.

Symptoms

The blinking alarm indicates an error.

How to solve

A possible solution to this problem is to check the software for malware or viruses. If there are no problems, the blinking alarm could be due to an incorrect setting or a miscommunication with the software.

Temp:0.8
Length:500

How to solve cannot add a new device to the product for Vedere Vessel Management Software on a Mercury.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Problem

The Vedere Vessel Management Software is unable to add a new device to the product.

Symptoms

There may be problems with the device, such as it not being recognized by the software or it being invalid. Additionally, the software may give an error when trying to add the device.

How to solve

The solution is to add the device manually.

createInternalSupportDocument

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:reset an alarm for a device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How to solve [KEYWORD] for [PRODUCT] on a [BOAT].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: The [PRODUCT] has [KEYWORD].
Symptoms Sentence:What are the symptoms for the following problem: A device has been set to an alarm and the Vedere Vessel Management Software has reset the alarm..
Instructions Sentence:Create a solution for the following problem: A device has been set to an alarm and the Vedere Vessel Management Software has reset the alarm..
Temp:0.8
Length:500

How to solve reset an alarm for a device for Vedere Vessel Management Software on a Mercury.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Problem

A device has been set to an alarm and the Vedere Vessel Management Software has reset the alarm.

Symptoms

The user may notice that the alarm is now going off more frequently or for longer periods of time.

How to solve

1. Reset the alarm in the device.
2. Contact Vedere Vessel Management Software for assistance resetting the alarm.

Title Sentence:How to solve [KEYWORD] for [PRODUCT] on a [BOAT].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: The [PRODUCT] has [KEYWORD].
Symptoms Sentence:What are the symptoms for the following problem: The Vedere Vessel Management Software has changed the alarm boundaries, causing alarms to go off for vessels that were previously not in the boundary..
Instructions Sentence:Create a solution for the following problem: The Vedere Vessel Management Software has changed the alarm boundaries, causing alarms to go off for vessels that were previously not in the boundary..
Temp:0.8
Length:500

How to solve changing the alarm boundaries for Vedere Vessel Management Software on a Mercury.

For model: Mercury, version: 1

Problem

The Vedere Vessel Management Software has changed the alarm boundaries, causing alarms to go off for vessels that were previously not in the boundary.

Symptoms

The symptoms for the following problem are alarm boundaries being changed and vessels that were not in the boundary before now being in the boundary.

How to solve

There is not a specific solution to this problem. However, it may be possible to adjust the alarm boundaries so that they are more accurately aligned with the actual boundaries of the vessel. Alternatively, it may be possible to create a new version of the Vedere Vessel Management Software that incorporates better alarm boundaries detection capabilities.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the device is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

Hello! I've been struggling to figure out how to fix a problem on my Vedere Vessel Management Software where the device has been stuck on a particular screen. The software seems to be stuck on a new image that was created after we startup the device for the first time in some time. My colleague and I have successfully attempted different launch scenarios but the issue persists. PLEASE HELP!

Comment

Thank you for reaching out to us! clearing the hard drive cache and reseating the device could resolve your issue.

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

Your pogram is showing a blank screen. This may be due to a corrupted file or an error in the application. To troubleshoot this issue, try the following:
-Check your internet connection and make sure it is secure; if possible, check for errors report any problems you find.
-Reboot your computer
-Physical phone problem: If you are still having problems with getting into your software, please contact customer service. They can assist you with setting up your device on their system and troubleshooting the software itself

Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for i have a blinking alarm on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for i have a blinking alarm on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

I have a blinking alarm on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Comment

The blinking alarm likely indicates a problem with the software. Depending on the nature of the problem, there are a variety of solutions available. First, please verify that all cables and plugs are properly connected to the computer and the dock. Next, check to see if there is any damage to the USB cable or power adapter. If neither of these solutions resolves the issue, please contact technical support for assistance.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for i cannot add a new device to the product on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for i cannot add a new device to the product on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

I am having an issue where I cannot add a new device to the product on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Apparently, this is something that others have been experiencing as well. In order to add a new device, I need to open the installation file and click on "Add Device." However, this button is not appearing on my screen. Instead, I am getting a message that says "Error 430: The remote server returned an error: (800) Bad Request."

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why you are unable to add a new device to your product, though it seems likely that there is a problem with the installation file. If you have not already done so, please try troubleshooting the installation by first performing a cache check and then reinstalling the product. If this does not resolve the issue, please contact Vedere Technical Support for assistance. Thank you for using our product!

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, the device is stuck.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, the device is stuck.

Symptoms

The Vedere Vessel Management Software is not working on my Mercury device. When I try to open the software, it says the device is stuck.

Comment

Dear customer,

We are sorry to hear that the Vedere Vessel Management Software is not working on your Mercury device. When we try to open the software, it says the device is stuck. Here are some troubleshooting steps that may help:

1. Check that your Mercury device is connected to the internet and running the latest software updates.

2. Reset your device by pressing and holding down the Power button and then selecting “Reset” from the menu that pops up.

3. If all of these steps fail to resolve the issue, please contact our customer service team for further assistance. Thank you for using Vedere!

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, i have a blinking alarm.

Symptoms

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, I get a blinking alarm every time there is any new data upload to the software. I've tried to reset the software, and/or the Mercury computer, but it doesn't seem to help.

Comment

What can I do?

There could be a problem with the USB port or cable on your Mercury. Try connecting the USB cable to another computer and see if the problem is resolved. If not, you may need to take your Mercury to a service center for repair.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:how do i change the alarm boundaries
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries.

Symptoms

Vedere Vessel Management Software was designed to manage and monitor large vessels. When using this software on a Mercury, some users notice that the alarms boundaries default to the entire ship, rather than specific water boxes. To change the alarm boundaries, users should first locate their "Alarm Boundaries" sheet in the software. Selecting this sheet will display all of the alarmed water boxes on a map. Next, users should move the mouse over each alarmed box and click to drag the boundary high enough so that only the selected box is alarms.

Comment

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how to remove an existing device.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how to remove an existing device.

Symptoms

The user wishes to remove an existing device from the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Comment

There are a few steps you can follow to remove an existing device from the Vedere Vessel Management Software: 1) Login to the product web site and "Manage Devices" on the home pag e. 2) On the Manage Devices page, click on the blue "Delete Device" link under the device's name. 3) Select whether you want to delete the device permanently or just suspend it. 4) Click on the blue "Delete Device" button to complete the removal process.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:enable the conning display
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury comm system is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. This shutdown occurs without warning and often requires a manual restart of the software to allow full functionality. This problem can be intermittent or persistent and affects both cruising and security functions of the Mercury. Reproducing the problem has not been possible despite multiple attempts.

Comment

This issue could be caused by a number of issues, including low battery voltage, software errors, or a corrupted file. In some cases, reapplying default configurations may resolve the issue. For persistent problems, please bring your Mercury on board and have our technical support team troubleshoot the issue.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When exiting the boat and attempting to restart the software, no media goes into the Camera section and the "Output" for that compartment is blank.

Comment

Oops! I'm sorry to hear that you have been experiencing problems with the camera. It sounds like something may be wrong with the camera software. If you have a physical Digital Camera, plug it into the computer and try to launch the camera software from there. If you have an iPad or iPhone, try launching the camera app from those devices. If that doesn't work, try contacting Customer Service for help troubleshooting your camera software.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I try to enable the alarm, it says that the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is shutting down.

Comment

Hello!

This could be a problem with your Mercury computer, or your Vedere Vessel Management Software. Try these steps to solve the problem:

1. Run a virus scan on your Mercury computer.
2. Make sure that your Mercury's operating system (the software that makes it run) is up to date.
3. Restart your Mercury computer.
4. Remove any new or recently installed programs from your Mercury.
5. If steps 3-5 still don't fix the problem, try talk to someone at Vedere Support about your issue

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:reset the alarms

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

mercury alarmis shutting down the vedere vessel management software application.

Comment

Symptoms:
1. The alarmis appears and shuts down the vedere vessel management software application.
2. When debugging is attempted, Mercury Integration Reports indicates that an invalid parameter was provided to the callback.
3. Out of memory errors are encountered when attempting to process retrieved values from outside resources.


Attempts should be made to verify whether the alarmis receiving valid inputs and failures can be traced back to a specific area in the code. If possible, additional unit or system checks should be made to confirm that all data retrieval is proceeding as initially planned. Maintaining a comprehensive error log will help identify and correct any issues as they occur, thus minimizing the potential for software failure and providing relevant information for forensics analysis if necessary.

Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Zoom Feature on my Mercury behaves erratically and shuts down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application unexpectedly.

Comment

There could be many potential causes as to why your Zoom Feature on your Mercury is behaving erratically and shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application unexpectedly. Some common causes include a loose or burnt ribbon cable connecting the camera hardware to the software or hardware issue with the camera Connections, further verifying that all hardware devices are properly seated and secure. If these simple troubleshooting measures do not resolve the issue, you may need to bring your Mercury in for service.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Upon startup of the Mercury, it is complaining that "configure the software is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application." This error message will keep popping up and Eventually Cut off the Mercury from accessing any software or internet.

Comment

Possible Solutions:
1. Verify that the Mercury computer connection is strong and free from buffering issues.
2. Restart your router and Mercury computer to test for connectivity issues.
3. Reset the Mercury's network settings by following these instructions: https://support.asus.com/ar-AE/ manual/AM2P3/HDMI_Remote_Reset_Setup_enu/
4. Verify that you are using the latest drivers for your Mercury software and peripheral devices.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

My Mercury is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application every time I install a brand new device. It happened with my mouse, and now it's happening with my printer. Every time I find a new solution on the internet, the software crashes right after I click "install."

Comment

The problem could be with the Mercury software or your device's driver. To troubleshoot the Mercury software, try updating it and verifying that all of your devices are compatible. If that doesn't solve the problem, try reinstalling the software. If you've installed a new device driver, try reloading it.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury engine management softwareapplication shuts down when the fire fighting priority mode is enabled. The firefighting priority mode disables some essential engine functions in order to improve safety.

Comment

Firefighting priority mode should only be enabled when effective, safe methods of fighting the fire are unavailable. This could occur if the engine is inaccessible because of the fire, or if bringing in firefighting assets would jeopardize the safety of those aboard the aircraft.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:disable the CCTV on the stern
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Background:
The stern CCTV is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software (VMS) application. Resolution:
There may be a conflict between the Vedere VMS installation and the onboard CCTV equipment. The first step in resolving this conflict may be to disable the onboard CCTV. This can be accomplished by following these steps:
A. Under System Preferences, open the Internet & Network Preferences pane and configure the TCP/IP protocol to use AUTO WB non-broadcast mode.

B. Launch VMS and select Options from the Instruments toolbar.

C. Under SystemOptions, uncheck Enable CCTV on stern.
D. Close VMS and reconfigure the network settings to reconnect to the network more frequently.

Comment

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:enable the alarm
Boat:Mercury
Version:1

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the alarm is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the alarm is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The alarm is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. The problem could be due to one of the following:

1. There is a virus or malware, installed on your computer, that is affecting the software. In this case, you will likely have to scan and remove any malware before you can continue.

2. There some issue with your computer's hardware, such as a corrupt hard drive, which can prevent the application from loading properly. You may need to get help from an experienced computer technician in order to diagnose and solve the issue.

3. There may be a problem with CapsLock key on your computer. Some users experience problems with the CapsLock key when using Vedere Vessel Management Software. If this is the case for you, try pressing and holding the Control (Ctrl) key while pressing the CapsLock key at the same time. If this still doesn’t resolve the issue, please enter into a Microsoft Support website and open an outbreak ticket asking for assistance diagnosing and repairing your computer problem.

Comment

Hi! Thanks for bringing this to our attention. Can you please elaborate a little more on what you mean by an 'outdated Java version'?

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Vedere Vessel Management Software is shutting down and the "reset alarms" button is not working.

Comment

Dear Customer,
Thank you for reaching out to us. We are sorry to inform you that Vedere Vessel Management Software is shutting down and the "reset alarms" button is not working. The software will be discontinued on December 31, 2018. Any prior data (activity logs, alarms, reports) associated with your account will be lost. We wish you all the best as you move forward. If you have any further questions or issues, please do not hesitate to contact our support team at support@vedere.com. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

I've been running the Vedere Vessel Management Software application on my computer with no issues until recenty when zooming to a different screen has caused the software to shut down. I'm not really sure what's causing it, but I think it might have something to do with how the software is handling my computer's graphics resources.

Is there anything I can do to fix thisissue? If so, what would be the best approach?

Comment

One possible cause of this problem may be if the graphics processing hardware on your computer is tooresource intensive for the software to run properly. One way you could try to address this may be by reducing the resolution and graphicsquality settings in the software. Another option might be to utilize a lower throughput networkconnection or by disabling texture compression in your browser. In somecases, these devices may need updates or special configurations in order to work with thesoftware. final conclusion:

If you experience crashes or other issues when zooming into different screens in the Vedere VesselManagement Software application, it might be helpful to try to reduce theresolution and graphics quality settings, use a lower throughputnetwork connection, or update any compatible devices.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:installing a brand new device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When a brand new device is installed and logged in to the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, it appears to be powering down the application. This problem can occur in Chrome, Firefox, or Internet Explorer browsers. Caused by an apparently buggy USB installation routine on Windows 10, this issue commonly occurs when using Windows' System Restore or backup/recovery features. Unfortunately there's not a simple fix on hand - restoring this particular user configuration becomes much more difficult if the device takes up any bulk storage on the computer.


However, if you've recentrly donated a used hard drive space to the organization's Habitat for Humanity building project (previously used for video capture and record keeping), then re-using that space contains a workaround which resolves this dialog box issue. When starting up the Vedere Vessel Management Software again from scratch, just open up a remote desktop session onto one of your workstation's local USB disks, copy over all of the video files and associated files and folders onto that drive, and log out of your organisation's accounts on the software's web site and devices. Users don't need to make any modifications to their usage, as those settings will have been pulled across automatically syncing their changes with the likely duplication of dependent HBHM-provided software overwriting previous Installation Data folder settings etc etc..

Comment

Windows 10 Cumulative Update System (MUCS) files (.CUS) contain a similar workaround for this application powerdowns.



A possible workaround for this issue is to re-use an old USB device that was previously used for video capture and record keeping. This will cause the software to start from scratch and pull any dependent files that were stored there.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my mercury, the stern camera displays an error message that says "disable CCTV on the stern is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application." I've tried tapping on the camera, opening the Applications folder, deleted and reinstalled the software, using a different satellite phone and internet connection, restarting my computer... nothing has worked so far.

Comment

Hello,
Have you tried calibrating the camera? If not, try reinstalling the software and see if it fixes the issue. If not, please take more information in your problem such as- when the error first occurred; what were you doing when the error occurred; did you delete or reinstall any software recently? Are you using a different satellite phone or internet connection? Also, can you provide any logs from your computer or phone that may help us troubleshoot the issue further?

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

My Mercury has a problem freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

Dear customer,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We would like to help you troubleshoot the issue as soon as possible. Please answer the following questions:


-When did this problem start occurring?
-What were your last actions with the application?
-Has anything changed recently that could possibly cause this problem?

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury model may reset the alarm system, causing it to freeze the Vessel Management Software Application. This can be remedied by resetting the alarms by:
-anding the wires for the shutdown/alarm system
- Igniting or disabling the onboard electric motor (if equipped)

Comment

The Mercury model reset the alarm system, causing it to freeze the Vessel Management Software Application. If a remedy is not forthcoming then the only recourse may be to reset the alarms by:

-anding the wires for the shutdown/alarm system
- Igniting or disabling the onboard electric motor (if equipped).

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury causes problems with the Vedere Vessel Management Software. Turning off the engines fixes the problem.

Comment

While it is possible that the problem could be with the Mercury's engine malfunctions, it is far more likely that the astronomical data used in the management software needs adjusts. The turning off of engines does nothing to correct this. It is necessary for the operator to contact the software manufacturer for further support and clarification.

Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I try to configure the software to work with the Vedere Vessel Management Software application it keeps freezing.

Comment

Hi!

There could be a few things that could be causing this problem:


-You might not have the latest version of the software installed. Check to make sure you're running the most up-to-date version and install any updates as needed.
-The Mercury XL is faster than older Mercury models, so you might experience some freezes when importing or editing certain data fields in the software. If this has been happening frequently, try switching to an older model of Mercury or trading in your Mercury for a different model.
-Make sure that your computer meets all of the system requirements,including minimum CPU speed and RAM, to handle Vedere Vessel Management Software.
If none of these solutions work, please contact customer support for further assistance.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Monitoring of the vessel Mr. Deeds' Giftwrap has stopped because a device was removed from the Vessel. The Vessel Management Software application has frozen and cannot be launched. There is no indication as to what caused the device to be removed from the Vessel.

Comment

There is no indication as to what caused the device to be removed from the Vessel. However, one possible cause could be that someone unauthorized accessed the Vessel through a system vulnerability, tampering with equipment, or other means. In order to prevent any further problems, it would be important for you to identify and diagnose any issues that may have led to this unauthorized access.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: installing a brand new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I try to install a new device, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application (which is run on a separate computer in the same room as the Mercury) freezes.

Comment

Hello,
This sounds like an issue with the software and not necessarily the Mercury. The cause could be a malfunctioning software program or hardware on your computer. Try clicking "start," " Task Manager," and " hidden processes" in order to find and identify the source of the problem. If that fails, you may need to uninstall and reinstall the software. If those solutions still do not work, you may need to contact Mercury customer service for assistance.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software

Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. The conning display is a critical instrument used for vessel navigation and managing the systems on board a vessel. Occasionally, the conning display can freeze and prevent the application from functioning normally. This issue can be resolved by restarting the computer or by clearing the computer's cache.

Comment

Thank you for contacting us about the problem with your Vedere Vessel Management Software application. We advise clearing the computer cache to resolve this issue. To clear the cache, follow these steps:

1. Press the Windows key and the R key at the same time. This will open the Run dialog box.
2. Type "chcache" and press Enter.
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to clear your computer's cache.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When the stern camera is turned on, it is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

The problem could be caused by a corrupted or missing piece of software that crops digital footage from the stern camera. Depending on how many packages of the software were purchased, contacting the vendor might provide a solution, though in this particular case it may not an immediate fix. Rebooting the device usually fixes most software problems. Depending on the severity of the issue, restarting the stern camera could harmcaptured footage.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:removing an old device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is freezing the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Deleting an old device, which is frozen in the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, is not possible.

Comment

This issue is caused by Python errors during the initialization process of the application. During runtime, Python tries to delete an old device which is frozen, but PowerShell fails to handle the exception. Consequently, an error message is displayed and the deletion is not possible. We recommend referring to our Python Troubleshooting guide to mitigate these errors.

Temp:1.2

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The fire fighting mode on the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is freezing the application.

Comment

The firefighting mode is part of the Vessel Management Software application and is used to update and control the vessel's position, speed, and other processes. When the firefighting mode is activated, it can increase the speed of the vessel by up to 30%. It also monitors ships for possible fires and can immediately divert resources to put out a fire.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury displays error messages that the conning display has been reset. The messages originate from the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. One of the error messages is: "Enable the conning display is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application." To fix the problem, disable the Vedere Vessel Management Software application and re-enable it.

Comment

The Mercury displays error messages that the conning display has been reset. The messages originate from the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. One of the error messages is: "Enable the conning display is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application." To fix the problem, disable the Vedere Vessel Management Software application and re-enable it.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Resetting the alarms on your Mercury device Ranger can restore functionality to your device. To reset the alarms: 1. Press and hold the SET UP button and then press the DISP/TV button together. 2. When the message "Vedere Vessel Management Software Installed" displays, release both buttons. 3. Hold down the POWER button until thedevice Off/Reset Mode message appears and then release the POWER button. 4. Press and hold the SET UP button for about 5 seconds, until "Vedere Vessel Management Software Resetting" appears onscreen. 5. Release the SET UP button. 6. During resetting, a green LED will light up in one of the four corners ofthe platform . When resetting is complete, or if there are any errors, the LED will turn off and the message "Vedere Vessel Management Software Verification OK" will appear onscreen. 7. Again, press and holdthe SET UP button for about 5 seconds, until "Vedere Vessel Management Software Updating" appearsonscreen; let go ofthe SET UP button when that message disappears. 8. Once updating is complete, press andrelease twiceboth DISP/TV buttons to return to normal operation


My Mercury refuses to play any audio including audiobooks because all of my alarms have been silenced by resetting them! How do I get my alarms back so I can listen to my audiobooks?

Comment

Your Mercury device is indicating that it needs to reset its alarms in order for your stereo to function properly again. To reset the alarms, follow these instructions: 1. Press and hold the SET UP button and then press the DISP/TV button together. 2. When the message "Vedere Vessel Management Software Installed" displays, release both buttons. 3. Hold down the POWER button until thedevice Off/Reset Mode message appears and then release the POWERbutton. 4. Press and hold the SET UPbutton for about 5 seconds,until "Vedere Vessel Management Software Resetting" Appears onscreen. 5. Releasethe SET UPbutton. 6. During resetting, aviolet LED will light up in one of the four cornersofthe platform . When resetting is complete, or if there are any errors, themessage "Vedere Vessel Management Software Verification OK" will appear onscreen. 7. Again, pressand holdthe SET UP button for about 5 seconds, until "Vedere VesselManagement Software Updating" appearsonscreen; let goocthe SET UPbutton when that message disappears. 8. Once updating is complete, press andrelease twiceboth DISP/TV buttonsto return tobnormal operation

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Whenever the driver zooming is activated, the Vedere Vessel Management Software reopens and the user has to scroll again to get back into the software.

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why this is happening. One potential issue is that the mouse capturing functionality within Vedere Vessel Management Software might be interfering with the driver zooming functionality. If this is the case, it might be possible to disable mouse capturing within Vedere Vessel Management Software in order to improvedriver zooming performance. Another possibility is that the user's window movement settings are causing problems. The user might need to adjust their window movements setting so that they exit Vedere Vessel Management Software when they zoom in and enter the software when they zoom out.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury Ridiculously Inflatable Automobile has a circuit or wiring problem that is intermittently resets the 0 AG mechanic control junction. Every two weeks or so, we must disable the engines to reset the problem; this happens even when the Hand Held Reset button is pushed and held down. Recently, we noticed that whenever the problem occurs- even if the reset button is NOT pushed- the engines will automatically restart after 2 minutes regardless of whether they are disabled or not. The Vedere Vessel Management Software application says that this "restarting of engines condition" is due to a "circuit/wire problem." We're at our wits' end, and have already tried contacting Mercury about this issue but never receive a reply. PLEASE HELP!

Comment

One possible cause for this problem could be that there is a circuit or wiring problem on the Mercury Ridiculously Inflatable Automobile that is intermittently resetting the 0 AG mechanic control junction. This problem happens even when the Hand Held Reset button is pushed and held down, so it is important that someoneEmail Mercury and report this issue so they can investigate and fix it.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

I have a 1995 Mercury Sable LS with the 5.0L V8 engine. The Problem is that the configurator software keeps resetting my Vedere Vessel Management Software application. I've been told that it might be because I'm not using the genlock feature, but I don't know how to fix that problem. Could you help me?

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why the configurator software might be resetting your Vedere Vessel Management Software application, but it's important to rule out any potential problems first. Make sure that you're using the genlock feature, and try to adjust the settings as exactly as possible to see if that resolves the issue. If either of those solutions doesn't work, then it might be necessary to revert to an earlier Version of the Vessel Management Software application. If all of those options fail to resolve the problem, please feel free to contact customer support for further assistance.

Comment

The hardware removal process reset the software, but an IT technician could reinstall the software using data from a backup or image.

Problem

How do i fix: enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When using the Vedere Vessel Management Software (VPMS), alarms may reset when attempting to open the application, or after manually opening the application. This problem may be caused by an old or faulty copy of VPMS, or by a problem with the software installer. To resolve this issue, you must perform one of the following:

Comment

1) Update your copy of VPMS. There is an online update available that will install the latest version of VPMS.

2) repair or replace the software installer.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:adding a new device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: adding a new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: adding a new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Whenever I add a new device to the network, the Vedere Vessel Management Softwareapplication becomes reset and I have to restart it.

Comment

When you add a new device to the network, your computer and the newest device might need to talk to each other about what's going on. The Vedere Vessel Management Softwareapplication sometimes gets reset as a result. To restart the application:

1. Display the Start menu on your computer.
2. Double-click the WindowsPE logo in the lower left corner of the screen.
3. Click All Programs > accessories > Microsoft Management Console (MMC).
4. In MMC, double-clickusrnetplwiz.msc, and then select the Ethernet Adapter drop-down list in Network Connections o Microsoft Management Console node, as shown in Figure 2-18.


Figure 2-18: Selecting the Ethernet adapter


5. Select Reset this instance of TCP/IP associated applciation and click Apply, as shown in Figure 2-19.


Figure 2-19: Resetting the TCP/IP application


6 Restart your computer after resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Softwareapplication by following the instructions that come up when you press F8 during startup or by using your system configuration tool . If a dialog box asks you what to do if service Unable to start appeared on supported systems, just click Do not try to start and continue with the reboot process. After your computer restarts, try connecting to your vessel again by navigating to www.vedere.com/manage 企业级网站及视频服务, selecting Your Vessel from the navigation bar and clicking Connection Information . If everything worked OK after resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Softwareapplication, there is no need to redo these steps again unless you experience another problem with your devices or network connection in which case try resetting your computer and networking components alternatively sync , referring back to Chapter 1 under Sync Instructions heading for instructions on syncing with Splash or other Apple products

Length:500

How do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Hello,
I own a Vedere Vessel Management Software (VMS) account, and I reset the alarms yesterday. However, later on I found out that my VMS account had been compromised; all of my activity within the platform has been wiped clean (all plants and data), leaving me completely in the dark as to how to get it up and running again. Can you please help me out?

Comment

Unfortunately, due to the password reset, your VMS account is now compromised. We are unable to help with restoring previous activity or setting up new alarms. If you would like more information on notifying authorities, or want to discuss any steps you may need to take in order to protect your data, please reach out to our support team at support@vedere.com. Thank you for using Vedere!

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Description:


In order to zoom in or out of a screen Within the Vedere Vessel Management Software application Live View screen smaller or larger tiles start decreasing and freezing on the screen.Sometimes this too will cause the software to reset.

Comment




This issue occurs when the user zooms in or out of the application while viewing tiles on the Live View screen. Since these tiles are representative of how many bottles of wine are left in a particular cellar, zooming in or out can lead to inaccurate information being displayed. If a user zooms in too far, the tiles will start decreasing in size, which can cause the software to freeze. In cases where this happens, returning to the original view may result in the software re-initializing.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:disable the engines
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The "disable the engines" checkbox within the Vessel Management Software application can be inadvertently clicked by a user,actions resulting in the software resetting and disabling the engines on the vessel. The resetting of this option sometimes corrupts vessel management data stores and may disable functionalities within the application.

Comment

An update to the Vessel Management Software application should be created to prevent accidental disabling of engines. The update should provide a warning if the "disable engines" checkbox is clicked and prevent the software from resetting if this checkbox is clicked. Additionally, other safeguards related to vessel management data stores should be implemented to prevent unwanted or unintentional changes.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: configure the software is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: configure the software is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Someone has put software pirating programs on their computer, and when Vedere Vessel Management Software is configured to use those programs for the automatic data input, the application resets itself, over and over again.

Comment

It would be strongly advised against adding unauthorized software-plugins to Vedere Vessel Management Software because doing so can cause unforeseen problems and likely damage the computer or lose business data. In order to maintain optimum performance while using Vedere Vessel Management Software, ensure that all software registrations and updates occur via the genuine, authorized source.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Pull up the "Settings" app on your device. Click on the button that says "General". Scroll down until you see a button that says "reset ang reset waddin". Tap on that button. On the next screen, click on the button that says "Erase Everything". On the next screen, verify that everything you want to delete is checked off and then click on the eraser icon. Once everything has been erased, restart your phone. After restarting, go back into the "Settings" app and pressing on the "Vendor Rooms & Equipment" option. In the displayed list, locate and tap on your Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Tap on the override key to disable it. If you're using a password, enter that password now and confirm it. If you're not using a password, tap on "Trust this device" to trust it. After disabling your Vedere Vessel Management Software application, tap on " Reset Device Configuration ". This will reset all of your settings back to their factory defaults which may restore connectivity with your device and allow you to install a new device.

Comment

3. Update the firefighting mode software if necessary to reflect changes in system configuration or application requirements.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The computer user has attempted to start the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, and is getting an error message that the enable conning display has not been verified.

Comment

When using the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, make sure that you have verified the enable conning display by going to Appearance > Controls and clicking on the Enable Conning Display button.

createCase

Temp:1.2

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I turn the GPS on, and select VCM, the CCTV on the stern is activated and it boots the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. I would like to disable this CCTV from booting so I can use VCM without it constantly activating.

Comment

Hi there! Thank you for reaching out. There might be a few things that could be done to try and resolve this problem. First, it might be worth trying turning off the CCTV from within VCM. System Menu/Vedere Vessel Management Software/Preferences->Control Panel->Security and Surveillance->CCTV should have some options to disable or turn on the CCTV module. It is also possible that your Mercury's firmware might be outdated, in which case upgrading to the most recent firmware update could resolves this issue. If those two options do not work then it is possible that your Mercury's system software may be incompatible with Vedere Vessel Management Software, in which case we would recommend laptop consulting to assist with installation and configuration. ;) Hope this helps!

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, my vehicle's alarm Only activates after the Vehicle launches Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Comment

Vehicle alarms are typically activated when the car is first started and after a collision. Vehicle launch could potentially influence an alarm, but it's not necessarily common. If you experience an alarm with your vehicle and you can't seem to culprit, please bring your car in for inspection.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: adding a new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury interactive computing device is not detecting new devices when plugged into the USB port. This problem occurs when adding new devices and subsequently attempting to boot the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing difficulties with the mercury device. Our team is looking into this and hope to have a resolution soon. In the meantime, you can try troubleshooting these issues yourself. First, double check if your Mercury device is properly plugged in - make sure it is seated securely into the computer's USB port. If your Mercury device is still not detected, seek help from our support team by submitting a ticket and providing as much information as possible.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

One of the Mercury's alarms is going off sporadically and I don't know how to fix it. Initially, I thought it might be something with the software but now I'm not sure. When I try to boot the software, I'm getting a message that the "reset administrative unit alarms" function isn't supported.

Comment

If you are experiencing problems with the Mercury alarm, it is important to troubleshoot and resolve the issue as soon as possible. In order to access the Mercury's reset administrative unit alarms function, you will need to use a DOS command. The command is "ground" and can be accessed by pressing [F1]-[DEL] when the Mercury power menu is displayed. The reset administrative unit alarms function will reset all of the alarm settings on the Mercury except for SCP alerter status. If you continue to experience problems with your Mercury alarm, please feel free to reach out to our support team for assistance.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:disable the engines
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Shortly after initiating the startup procedure for the Mercury base computer, one or more of the Mercury engines suddenly turns off. Despite numerous attempts to turn on the engines manually (by pressing both power and Reset controls), the engines will not start; neither will the initialization sequence within Vedere Vessel Management Software. The only apparent cause seems to be that one or more of the engine control modules is malfunctured, and disabling them appears to correct the problem. Though it is easy to bypass this issue by booting into a Windows-based operating system, doing so defeats much of Mercury's special innovative functionality and could potentially lead to serious health and safety problems. There seems to be no way to fix this problem except through manual intervention.

Comment

If you are experiencing a problem with one or more Mercury engines, your first step should be to disable the affected engines using Vedere Vessel Management Software. After disabling the engines, you can attempt to start them manually by pressing both power and Reset buttons. If the engines still will not start, your next step should be to replace the engine control modules. If you are unable to solve the problem through manual intervention or replacement of engine control modules, then your Mercury base computer may have a virus or other malware that is causing the issue. In this situation, you may need to have the Mercury base computer repaired.

createCase
