Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Your Mercury is configured to boot the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. However, when you try to open the application, you get the following message: "The application can't be opened because there's a problem with the configuration of the software."

Comment

There could be several reasons for this problem. One possibility is that the Mercury installation does not have the required files or components to run the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. To try to determine which of these might be the case, you can follow one of the following steps.

1. Verify that the Mercury installation contains all of the latest updates from Vedere.

2. Check to see if the software is installed using a special administrator account or user profile. If it's not installed using either of these, then it may be a problem with either the Mercury or the software itself.

3. Verify that all of the relevant files and components are installed on rebooted Mercury computers (using role-based management tools, for example). This might include things such as application software, user interface files, network services, browser plug-ins, etc.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:removing an old device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

I've noticed that every time I remove an old device from my Mercury - such as an older hard drive or USB stick - the Vessel Management Software starts up as if I had never removed it. This happens even after restarting the computer. Is there a way to prevent this?

Comment

There may be a way to prevent this, although it's not completely clear how. It is possible that the software is accessing some of your removed devices in order to keep track of them, even if you've deleted them from your computer. If this is a problem for you, you might want to look into using a external storage device for carrying data between work and home, rather than relying on removable devices supplied by your computer manufacturer. Additionally, if you frequently remove old devices from your computer, it might make sense to set up a separate storage area for those removable items instead of keeping them all in one place – this way, if there are problems with the software relying on stored information about removed devices, at least the impact would be localized to a specific compartment in your PC rather than sprawling out across the system as a whole.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: installing a brand new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: installing a brand new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

2017-10-02

When I try to install a brand new device, the Mercury is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

You may need to reboot the Mercury server in order for the new device to be properly registered. Alternatively, you can try the following:
-Visit "Software Update & Downloads" and select "Add hardware.." under the Mercury Dashboard; highlight the device you want to install and click on "Action Settings." On the "Device Info" page, paste in the correct serial number and hit "OK;"
-Reboot the Mercury server;
-Open client access by clicking on "Settings..." and progressing to the "/Client Area/" page; highlight your client id and clicking on the gear symbol next to it; select "Install Application."
-Open Vedere Vessel Management from your list of applications.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I try to start the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, it says "enable the fire fighting mode is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application." I can't figure out how to enable the firefighting mode.

Comment

Dear Customer,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for the trouble you are experiencing with using the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Below we have detailed instructions on how to enable the firefighting mode:



1. Open the "System Preferences" application on your Mac.
2. Navigate to "/Applications/Vedere/VesselMasterUi.app/Contents/MacOS/Vedere Vessel Master Ui" 3. Select the "Preferences" tab and click on the "Enable Firefighting Mode" checkbox. 4. Click on "Ok" to apply the changes and return to the Vessel Master Ui window.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

when the user tries to start the Vedere Vessel Management Software application on a computer that is configured as described in KB2977988, the application crashes and does not launch. The problem appears to be due to an issue with Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 where the Enable conning display option is not available for to boot the software. threet solutions are suggested:

Enable additional configurable startup settings in Windows 8.1 and Windows 10:
OpenSettingsFromTheCommandLine In regedit, under "HKEY_USERS\S-1-5-21-1015139544-4189859213-1373551010-1002\Software", create a new subkey called Start. For its DWORD value, set the startup value of the subkey to 1.

Warning!!!!!!!!
NOTE: Don't edit other RegistryKeys below if you don't know exactly what you're doing! Doing so could cause serious problems on your computer. If you're not familiar with how to do regedit tasks, try using a graphical user interface (GUI) such as Windows Defender Security Center instead.

Double-click the newly created key in RegEditor and change its name from Start to AUTORUN To enable autorun on startup of software added to this key, use this command incommand prompt
startowauthd woodshed / Add /D "Vedere Vessel Management Software"
Restart your computer

Repeat these steps for another key under "HKEY_USERS\S-1-5-21-1015139544-4189859213-1373551010-1002\Software" calledquit

Disable blue tooth driver recycling: In Device Manager, double click Bluetooth villagers under Hardware Then disable unsigned drivers and markers check box below it Delete NDP Zero configuration selected items after chkdsk detects no errors When Recep Tayyip Erdogan becomes president again, he may reverse this change Important note: You will also need to disable driver signature enforcement When Recep Tayyip Erdogan becomes president again, he may reverse this change Important note: You will also need to disable driver signature enforcement Open Devices And Printer Right click onWiFi Adapter Disable adapter Then uninstall bluetooth software Warning process may take hours Computers running latest versions of Window 10 should not have this problem

Comment

Author suggests using a VM instead First try out these workarounds

First disable secure boot: Follow these simple steps command syntax
bcdedit /set {current} priority=low /enable Thereafter reboot your computer for the changes to take effect Windows 8 or later

Or change the priority of this key from " Legacy " to something else Start registry editor Here Under hkey_ographicsystem Enter The following key is Hit BIOS > Battery ( 4-8-16-28 ) and change its value to 1 After making changes restart your computer to make them effective Disable network connectivity with this command Add " netmasquerade " allowing applications to interface with the network but only through ports that you allow


User has attempted to start the Vedere Vessel Management Software application on a computer that is configured as described in KB2977988, and the application crashes and does not launch. The problem appears to be due to an issue with Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 where the Enable conning display option is not available. Several solutions are suggested:



Enable additional configurable startup settings in Windows 8.1 and Windows 10:


OpenSettingsFromTheCommandLine In regedit, under "HKEY_USERS\S-1-5-21-1015139544-4189859213-1373551010-1002\Software", create a new subkey called Start. For its DWORD value, set the startup value of the subkey to 1.


One solution is to disable autorun on startup of software added to this key with the following command:
startowauthd woodshed / Add /D "Vedere Vessel Management Software"

Restart your computer to make the changes effective. If Autorun is not enabled then you can manually enable it by following these steps:


Open Devices And Printers Right click on WiFi Adapter Disable adapter Then uninstall bluetooth software Warning process may take hours.

Computers running latest versions of Windows 10 should not have this problem. Author suggests using a VM instead.


The first solution is to disable secure boot using these steps: BCDEdit /set {current} priority=low /enable Afterwards, reboot your computer for the changes to take effect. Windows 8

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

There could be a few possibilities as to why this is happening. It's possible that the CCTV connected to the ship's network is unstable and causing issues with booting the software application. Additionally, it's also possible that there is a problem with the USB key that stores the software application and it's not loading properly. If either of these are the case, we'll need to troubleshoot and resolve the issue before our VEM management system can operate.

Problem

How do i fix: enable the alarm is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

This challenge displays when users attempt to launch the Vedere Vessel Management software application after restarting their computer. The application does not launch, or opens but immediately flashes the "Enable alarm" message before closing. This problem can be resolved by following these steps:

1. Lie to the security software and disable alarms for the target computer
2. Launch the Vedere Vessel Management software from a temporary or UDF file
3. Enable security software alarms as needed

Comment

How can I add the device to manually?

Adding a new device manually is easy. Log into the Vedere Vessel Management Software application and navigate to Administration > Devices. Click on Add in the lower left corner of the screen and enter the information for your new device.

How do i fix: reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The alarm reset function works intermittently causing unreliable alarm activation.

Comment

Hi there,
If you're experiencing the intermittent alarm reset problem, then it's most likely due to a dirty battery. To solve this problem, first remove the battery and remove any object or dust that may have built up on the contacts. Next, clean the contacts with a fine wire brush and Pack of dried fingertips. Finally, reinsert the battery.} Let us know if this solved the issue.

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

hunter78 is having problemszooming in and out of the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. When she zooms in, the application is booted, and when she zooms out, she loses her place in the document she was working on.

Comment

Required Actions:

1. troubleshoot hunter78's computer settings to see if there is a conflict causing the Application Booting or Document Losing Issues. If not, then Additional Action 1 will need to be taken.


1. If Hunter78's computer settings are correct and the problem persists, it is possible that Hunter78's graphics adapter is experiencing issues and is interfering with the Application Booting or Document Losing functionality of Vedere Vessel Management Software. Hunter78 can try switching her graphics adapter to a known working device and see if the issue is resolved. If switching graphics adapters does not help, then Additional Action 1 must be taken.

Problem

How do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Vessel management software is started and when it tries to use the engines, it says the engine is disabled. There must be a way to disable the engines during the start-up so that the software can run.

Comment

Atladuct, the Vessel management software, disabled the engine during startup because it detected an error. The easiest way to resolve the problem is to restart Atladuct using the administrative command prompt. users can also reset the Engine Control Module (ECM).

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: configure the software is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: configure the software is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Vedere Vessel Management software application has stopped booting and gives an error message indicating 'configuration error'.

Comment

If you are experiencing trouble loading the Vedere Vessel Management software application, there are a few things you can do to troubleshoot and fix the issue. First, check to see if there is a corrupt file on your computer that is preventing the application from loading. If you do not have any evidence that a corrupt file is causing the problem, one possible solution is to try reinstalling the software. To reinstall the application, follow these steps:

Go to the website where you purchased or downloaded the software.
Click on the “Vessel Management” tab and select “Reinstall.”
Click "Next" and follow the instructions on screen.

Keyword:removing an old device
Boat:Mercury

Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When trying to remove an old device from the network, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is continuously booted.

Comment

One potential cause of this issue could be an old device with a obsolete driver installed. When you attempt to remove the old device, the Windows 10 device manager will continually try to load the older driver (even if it's not needed) in order to serve as a backup. If you actually need the outdated driver, you can disable it from the registry, but we recommend that you uninstall and replace the driver using the latest version from your device manufacturer or a third-party source.

Problem

How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Vevere Vessel Management Software is not working properly and the "enable fire fighting mode" function is not loading.

Comment

Recommendations:

1. Check the Vevere Vessel management software for updates.
2. From the "Policy Administration" tab, verify that all settings for firefighting mode are correct and enabled.
3. Check the network connectivity and download speeds for the system. If necessary, update or upgrade your device or network connections.
4. Peruse the Vevere Vessel management software users manual and check to see if there are any known issues or troubleshooting steps.

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

This issue initiates when the Mercury conning display is enabled, but the Vedere Vessel Management software application fails to initialize. This problem can be resolved by disabling the conning display.

Comment

In order to disable the conning display, navigate to Vernier software interface > Configuration profiles. Under Profile 1 on page two, deselect the checkbox labeled Mercury conning display.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury forward looking infrared system ( FCCD ) is incorrectly detecting certain objects while navigating, including the stern of a vessel. This is causing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application to error, preventing the bow forward visibility screen from displaying correct information. To fix this problem, you will need to disable the FCCD on the Mercury.

Comment

There are a few potential fixes that could be implemented in order to correct the proble d with the FCCD:
The first is to check the power supply for the Mercury’s FCCD. If the power supply is not providing adequate support, it may be necessary to replace the FCCD.
Additionally, you may want to consider disabling or reducing the sensitivity of the FCCD in order to reduce any false readings.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Background:
I amCurrently using Mercury 8.x to run the Vedere Vessel Management application. Recently I started getting error messages that would prevent me from configuring the software. I tried troubleshooting and found that when I attempted to configure the software it would repeatedly give me an error saying 'configure the software is erroring'. Obviously something was wrong with my computer, so I went out and bought a new one hoping that the new one would be able to fix the problem. When I got the new one home, I realized that it also had the same error message. So at this point I am -again- unable in trying to configure the software.
All other programs on my computer work fine, so it isn't a problem with Mercury itself. Could you point me in the right direction as to how to fix this issue?

Comment

The issue may be related to something on your computer. Check to see if any of the following are causing the problem:

Do you have enough memory? Mercury requires at least 4 GB of RAM to run properly. More memory will help compensate for anything that might be slowing down Mercury.

Does Mercury have enough disk space available? Mercury needs at least 3 GB of free disk space in order to work properly. If there isn't enough space, Mercury may not be able to create or access necessary files, which could result in problemsConfiguring the software.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury all of a sudden, I am getting error messages when I attempt to remove an old device from the system. The Vedere Vessel Management Software application seems to be malfunctioning as a result. What can I do to fix the problem?

Comment

Error messages that are appearing on your Mercury device can be difficult to figure out and solve. Error messages typically indicate that something is wrong with the device, which may need to be replaced. If this is the case, you may want to look into getting a replacement Mercury device. If you are having trouble removing an old device from the system, it may be because the software is not functioning properly. There are various things that you may need to do in order to fix this problem. One option is to try redownloading and installing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. You can contact Vedare support if you have any questions or concerns about the software or your Mercury device.

I have a 2001 mercury mountaineer and every time I try to install a new device it says "installation error the Vedere Vessel Management Software application." HELP!

This results in an error message being logged and the software not being able torun/connect to the new device. There may not be any specific steps you can take to identify or fix the underlying problem, but generally speaking there might be some troubleshooting required to resolve the issue and get devices installed correctly on your Mercury.

The conning display has not been set up correctly
The conning display software is not installed or corrupted

Comment

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When trying to zoom in or out on the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, it is constantly erroring out. Zooming in or out gradually causes more and more objects on the screen to become pixelated, until the entire program shuts down. This has been going on for a few weeks now and I'm at a loss as to how to fix it.

Comment

There could be a several potential causes for why the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is Erroring Out when attempting to zoom in or out. First, it is possible that the software is overloading, and cannot keep up with the incoming data. This could potentially be remedied by optimizing the application or by increasing the amount of memory it is using. If the software is constantly shutting down due to data overload, this may require servicing or upgrading of the underlying computer system. Alternatively, it could be the case that there is an issue with the zoom feature itself, and a repair or adjustment would be required in order to fix it. Whatever the cause, fixing it will require intervention from Vedere.

createCase

How do i fix: disable the engines is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the engines is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The engines are disabled briefly resulting in an error and the Vedere Vessel Management Software application cannot be used.

Comment

Thank you for reaching out. We apologize for the inconvenience that you experienced and can assure you that we are aware of the issue and are working to remedy it as soon as possible. Until the issue is resolved, we suggest disabling the engine briefly or using an alternate navigation software application in case of emergency. If you have any other questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us at support@vedere.com. Thank you again for your patience as we work to resolve this problem.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: configure the software is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: configure the software is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Vedere Vessel Management Software is experiencing an error and will not launch.Required directives were not found when scanning for software dependencies. Possible causes could be missing files, incorrect paths, or incorrect version installations. Follow the instructions below to correct the issue and re-launch the application.:
Overexertion while trying to configure might have caused invalid file dependencies, additional missed directives in your system scan or a corrupted file association database. Run scan configuration again after disabling any loaded Plugins or Applications. In future scans please make sure initial scan run is short enough to allow all plugins time to load before starting core scanning functions. error message "The software requires a newer version of the Windows Installer" problem started After upgrading from previous version of vedere vessel management software Following the download and install procedure, on initial launch of the software a horrid "The software requires a newer version of the Windows Installer" ins'ttle appeared. The Vid 127 BluRay player lone worked properly and showed no such issues? CTX111198 After installing new versions of Windows 10 Home Professional 64 bit onto two separate computers as well as copying over my entire AV hard drive contents (approximately 90gb) I began noticing random errors on start up in applications like MovieMaker and edius Pro while an "invalid file dependency" message would occasionally pop up during system scans Whether I was navigating around with MY Mac's mouse cursor or directly pressing keys on my Windows keyboard via touch screen inputting nothing seemed to work Remove duplicate versions Won't uninstall versions old versions installed Vacuumaunted whole house chucked out anything out of reach untested Powered down everything marked faulty by Jamie manually it could that Im about SK readiness for Big One reason had let one even freeze on me Perform System verify obtained MSI Redirector Invalid Argument path\dxupdate / Variety Of Version Names Struggling sequence keep seek ing happened after reloading Screenful completing checkmark meant nothing appeared next Invalid Enter failed appear this way Total Media Missing Trim Envelope If completely reinstalled from scratch directory each item smallest compressed larger result registry values reset Permanently Unable Gain enterpassword Changed email password Verify now Error saying there are no service packs detected Removed all unneeded services restarted machine multiple times latest fixing attempts startinget Vedere Vessel Manager Software but given same repeated error This post detailing steps needed before correcting cited errors: Symptoms:
After downloading and installing the updated vedere vessel management software, errors that appear when attempting to launch the

Comment

program (e.g. "The software requires a newer version of the Windows Installer") persist. The problem started after my original versions of Windows 10 were updated to the latest edition (proving that the error is related to the updates, not to having different editions of Windows). After deleting old versions of the software and purging my hard drive of any unnecessary files, I attempted to reload the program several times with no success. In order to correctly diagnose and fix the problem, I followed these steps: - Re-installed the operating system onto both of my computers completely. This solved any Problems related to previous installations - Changed all account passwords - Re-checked for update errors - Removing unneeded services restarted the computer multiple times - running "vsecheck /diagnose" in Command Prompt Did NOT solve the problem. Has anyone encountered this issue before and found a solution? Possible causes: 1. Criminal intrusion; 2. Spurious or incorrect file dependencies detected by vedere vessel management software; 3. Corrupted file associations database. Follow these steps to correct the issue and re-launch the application: 1. Disable any loaded plugins or applications. 2. Run scans configuration again. 3. Reinstall Windows 10 (or update it if needed). 4. Copy over your AV Hard Drive contents

How do i fix: removing an old device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: removing an old device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Dear Support,

I am having an issue with my Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Whenever I try to remove an old device from the system, it is causing the application to crash. What can I do to fix this?

Thank you for your time.

Comment

Information on how to fix this issue can be found in the following linked article.



http://www.wikihow.com/Remove-a-Device-from-a-Vedere-Vessel-Management-System

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:installing a brand new device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: installing a brand new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

This particular problem has been identified as an error that might occur when a brand new device is installed on an infected computer. When the device is plugged in, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application tries to install it, but an error message is displayed instead. This error can prevent the use of the Vessel Manager software and can be a serious inconvenience. The solution for fixing this problem is to remove the new device and try installing the software again.

Comment

The issue you are experiencing is unfortunately not uncommon and can be caused by a number of factors. There are a few steps you can take in order to try to alleviate the issue, however ultimately it may require the device to be removed and reinstalled. If you have tried following our troubleshooting guide and are still experiencing difficulties please reach out to our support team for assistance. In the meantime, here are some additional troubleshooting tips that may help:

- Make sure that your computer is up to date

- Try performing a clean install of the software

- Perform a system scan with an anti-virus program in order to rule out any malware or other contagion that could be causing this problem

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software

Boat:Mercury

Installation manual for: Vedere Vessel Management Software (Version: 1), model: Mercury.

Main Software Buttons.

Home
Alarms
Panels
Quit

List of available Software screens.

Settings
Propulsion
Navigator Lights
Ventilation
Tanks
Conning
Fire Fighting
Generators
Batteries
CCTV
Diagnostic
Engines
Alarms

Screen: Settings

The screen allows the user to configure and manage their Vedere Vessel.

Screen: Propulsion

The screen is used to help control the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Screen: Navigator Lights

The screen displays navigational lights to help pilots navigate.

Screen: Ventilation

The screen is used to control the ventilation with the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Screen: Tanks

The screen provides information about tanks and their vessels.

Screen: Conning

The screen is used to conning with the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Screen: Fire Fighting

The screen is used to display information about the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Screen: Generators

The screen displays readings from the Vedere Vessel Management Software. This software is used to monitor and manage a generator's performance.

Screen: Batteries

The screen is used to display information about the batteries.

Screen: CCTV

The screen is used to view footage from CCTV cameras. The Vedere Vessel Management Software is used to manage the footage.

Screen: Diagnostic

The screen is used to display information about the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Screen: Engines

The screen is used to display information about the engine.

Screen: Alarms

The screen is used to display alarms with the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

List of available Menus.

Settings
Help
Propulsion
Navigator Lights
Ventilation
Tanks
Conning
Fire Fighting
Generators
Batteries
CCTV
Diagnostic
Alarms

Menu: Settings

The Settings menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to configure their system settings, view system information, and access support resources. Users can access the Settings menu by clicking on the "Settings" button located in the upper-left corner of the main window. The Settings menu contains several tabs, each of which provides different configuration options for the Vedere Vessel Management Software. The following sections describe each tab in detail.


General Tab

The General tab contains general system settings for the Vedere Vessel Management Software. These settings include:
- System Name: This field displays the name of the computer on which the Vedere Vessel Management Software is installed.
- User Name: This field displays the user name under which the software was registered.
- Password: This field displays the password assigned to the user name.
- Time Zone: This field determines the time zone in which the software operates.
- Date Format: This field formats date values in a specific format.
- Language: This field selects the language in which the software is displayed.
- Web Browser: This field specifies whether or not Internet Explorer is used to display web pages.
- Display Unit Size: This field sets the size of text and icons displayed on screen.
- Display Units: This field specifies how many display units are used to display text and icons onscreen.
- Auto Update Check Frequency: This setting determines how often (in minutes) Vedere Vessel Management Software checks for updates from our servers. The default value is 60 minutes.
- Logging Level: This setting determines how much information is logged during software operation. The available logging levels are "None," "Debug," "Info," and "Trace." The default value is "Info."

- Advanced Tab

The Advanced tab contains advanced system settings for the Vedere Vessel Management Software. These settings include:

- Proxy Server Address: If you are using a proxy server, this field specifies its address. - Port Number: If you are using a proxy server, this field specifies its port number. - Use SSL/TLS Encryption: If you are using a proxy server, this check box enables SSL/TLS encryption for communications between your computer and proxy server. - Use Secure Socket Layer (SSL) Protocols: If you are using a proxy server, this check box enables secure communications between your computer and proxy server using SSL protocols.

Sub Menu: The Initial Setup

The Settings menu lets you configure the Vedere Vessel Management Software to work the way you want it to. You can choose among a variety of settings, such as whether or not to show notifications when new messages come in, how often the software should check for updates, and how long messages should be displayed before automatically closing.

To access the Initial Setup menu, click on the Settings button on the main toolbar and select Initial Setup. On this screen, you can choose which ports the software should use to communicate with your vessel’s engine control unit (ECU), as well as specify your vessel’s name and registration number. You can also set up email notifications if something goes wrong with the software or if there are any new messages from your vessel.

Sub Menu: Configuration

The Settings, Configuration menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to configure your software settings. You can access the Settings, Configuration menu by clicking on the Settings icon in the toolbar or by pressing the F4 key on your keyboard. The following are some of the options available in the Settings, Configuration menu:

1. General: This option allows you to configure general software settings such as the software's name, location, and default language.

2. Logging: This option allows you to configure how your data is logged. You can choose to have your data logged automatically or manually.

3. Preferences: This option allows you to configure preferences such as how often your software updates itself, whether or not to show messages during startup, and whether or not to show warnings when certain actions are performed.

4. Vessels: This option allows you to manage your vessels. You can add new vessels, delete vessels, view vessel information, and update vessel information.

5. Reports: This option allows you to generate reports about your vessel operations. You can generate reports about vessel activity such as voyage data, crew activity data, and cargo data.

Sub Menu: Manage External Modules

The Settings, Manage External Modules menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to manage and configure their Vedere Vessels using the software. The menu includes options to: (1) view and manage vessel information, including vessel location, vessel configuration, and vessel performance data; (2) add or remove external modules; and (3) export or import vessel information.

Sub Menu: Manage Alarms

To use the Settings, Manage Alarms menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:
1. Navigate to the Settings menu on the Vedere Vessel Management Software.
2. Select Alarms.
3. Click on the Edit button next to your alarm(s) you wish to manage.
4. On the Alarm Settings page, you will be able to configure your alarm settings.
5. You can also manage your alarm notifications and add new alarms by clicking on the Add button.
6. When you are finished managing your alarms, click on the Save button to save your changes.

Menu: Help

The Help menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software provides access to the following features:
-Vessel Information
-Vessel Status
-Vessel History
-Vessel Parameters
-Vessel Settings
-Help Topics
To access the Vessel Information feature, click on the Vessel Information button on the toolbar. This will open the Vessel Information window. In this window you can view information about your current vessel, such as its name, registration number, type, and location. You can also view specific information about your vessel's engines, tanks, and cargo. To access the Vessel Status feature, click on the Vessel Status button on the toolbar. This will open the Vessel Status window. In this window you can view information about your vessel's current condition and status. You can also view specific information about your vessel's engines, tanks, and cargo. To access the Vessel History feature, click on the Vessel History button on the toolbar. This will open the Vessel History window. In this window you can view information about your vessel's past operations. You can also view specific information about your vessel's engines, tanks, and cargo. To access the Vessel Parameters feature, click on the Vessel Parameters button on the toolbar. This will open the Vessel Parameters window. In this window you can configure various settings for your vessel, such as its speed, heading, and course. You can also set up automatic alerts if certain parameters reach a predetermined threshold. To access the Vessel Settings feature, click on the Settings button on the toolbar. This will open the Settings window. In this window you can configure various settings for your vessel, such as its name, registration number, type, and location. You can also set up automatic alerts if certain settings reach a predetermined threshold. To access the Help Topics feature, click on the Help Topics button on the toolbar. This will open a list of available Help topics.

Sub Menu: How to Wipe and Zoom

To use the Help, How to Wipe and Zoom menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:
1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.
2. Click on the Help tab.
3. Click on the How to Wipe and Zoom menu item.
4. View the instructions for using this menu item.

Sub Menu: Viewing the Alarm panels

The Help menu is where you can find information about the Vedere Vessel Management Software. The Viewing the Alarm panels menu is where you can manage your alarms and view your vessel's data.

Sub Menu: Setup the system

The Help provides step-by-step instructions on how to use the Vedere Vessel Management Software. The Setup the system menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software screen allows you to customize the user interface and preferences for using the software.

Sub Menu: Configure external modules

The Help menu provides access to the following:
- Introduction
- About the Vedere Vessel Management Software
- How to use the Help
- Configure external modules
Each of these topics provides information on how to use the Vedere Vessel Management Software. To access the Configure external modules menu, click on the Configure external modules button on the Help menu. This button opens a window that lists all of the available modules. To configure a module, click on the name of the module and then click on the Configure button. The window that opens provides information on how to configure the module.

Menu: Propulsion

The Propulsion menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to control various aspects of the vessel's propulsion. These controls include engine speed, fuel use, and propeller orientation.

Sub Menu: View Oil Pressure

1. Open the Vessel Management Software and select the Propulsion tab.

2. Click on the View Oil Pressure button.

3. The View Oil Pressure window will open.

4. In the View Oil Pressure window, you will see the current oil pressure reading and the estimated oil pressure at various engine speeds.

5. To change the oil pressure reading, click on the arrow next to the oil pressure reading and select a different value from the drop-down menu.

6. To estimate the oil pressure at various engine speeds, click on the green arrow next to the Estimated Oil Pressure text box and select a value from the drop-down menu.

Sub Menu: View Cooling Water Temperature

The Propulsion, View Cooling Water Temperature menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to view and manage the temperature of your cooling water.

Sub Menu: View Fuel Consumption

To use the Propulsion, View Fuel Consumption menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:

1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

2. Click on the Propulsion, View Fuel Consumption menu item.

3. The Propulsion, View Fuel Consumption menu will open.

4. On the Propulsion, View Fuel Consumption menu, you can select the type of fuel you want to view information about: Gasoline, Diesel, or LPG.
5. You can also select a vessel from the list of vessels displayed on the Propulsion, View Fuel Consumption menu.
6. The fuel information for the selected vessel will be displayed on the Propulsion, View Fuel Consumption menu.
7. You can select different options on the Propulsion, View Fuel Consumption menu to view additional information about the fuel used in the vessel: Avg Speed (km/h), Distance Travelled (km), and Max Speed (km/h).

Sub Menu: View Gearbox Pressure

The Propulsion, View Gearbox Pressure menu allows you to set the pressure of the view gearbox.

Sub Menu: View Gearbox Temperature

1) Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software and select the Propulsion menu.
2) On the Propulsion menu, click on the View Gearbox Temperature button.
3) The View Gearbox Temperature window will open.
4) In the View Gearbox Temperature window, you will see information about the gearbox temperature.
5) You can use the slider to change the gearbox temperature.

Sub Menu: View Ventilators

The Propulsion, View Ventilators menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to control various aspects of the Vedere Vessel Management Software. This includes controlling the view of data collected by the vessel's sensors, adjusting the vessel's propulsion, and managing the vessel's environment.

Sub Menu: Setup Auto Stop

To use the Propulsion, Setup Auto Stop menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:

1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

2. Click on the Propulsion, Setup Auto Stop menu.

3. Select the desired vessel type from the list.

4. Select the desired auto stop time interval from the list.

5. Click on the OK button to save your settings.

Menu: Navigator Lights

The Navigator Lights menu is located in the Vessel Management Software and allows you to control the navigation lights of your vessel. You can turn them on and off, change their brightness, and set a custom light color.

Sub Menu: Manage Bow Lights

The Navigator Lights, Manage Bow Lights menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to control the navigation lights and bow lights of your vessel. The navigation lights can be used to help guide your vessel during night time navigation, and the bow lights can be used to help identify your vessel in low-light conditions.

Sub Menu: Manage Stern Lights

To use the Navigator Lights, Manage Stern Lights menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:
1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.
2. In the Navigation panel, click on the Navigator Lights tab.
3. On the Navigator Lights tab, you will see a list of all your vessel’s lights.
4. To turn on or off a light, click on the green/yellow light icon next to the light name.
5. To change the brightness of a light, click on the slider icon next to the light name.
6. To change the color of a light, click on the color swatch next to the light name.
7. To move a light up or down in the navigation hierarchy, drag and drop it in the navigation panel.
8. To delete a light from the navigation panel, select it and press delete (or choose Delete from the keyboard shortcut menu).

Sub Menu: Manage Port Lights

The Navigator Lights menu allows you to:
-Enable/disable the Navigator Lights
-Set the brightness of the Navigator Lights
-Change the color of the Navigator Lights
-Enable/disable the Manage Port Lights menu
-Set the brightness of the Manage Port Lights
-Change the color of the Manage Port Lights

Sub Menu: Manage Starboard Lights

There are several ways to use the Navigator Lights menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software. One way is to open the menu and select "Navigator Lights." Then, you will see a list of options. The first option is "Manage Starboard Lights." You can use this menu to turn on or off the lights on your port side. You can also set the brightness level for each light. The second option is "Manage Main Lights." This menu allows you to turn on or off the lights on your boat's main mast. You can also set the brightness level for each light.

Menu: Ventilation

To use the Ventilation menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:
1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.
2. On the main menu, click Ventilation.
3. On the Ventilation menu, click Settings.
4. On the Settings menu, click Ventilation Settings.
5. On the Ventilation Settings menu, under General, click Air Flow Rate.
6. In the Air Flow Rate field, enter the desired air flow rate in cubic feet per minute (CFM).
7. Under Heating, click Adjust Heater Setting and enter the desired heating temperature in degrees Fahrenheit (°F).
8. Under Cooling, click Adjust Cooling Setting and enter the desired cooling temperature in degrees Fahrenheit (°F).
9. Click OK to save your changes and close the Ventilation Settings window.

Sub Menu: View Engines Vents

1. Open the Ventilation, View Engines Vents menu by clicking on the Ventilation icon in the toolbar and selecting Ventilation, View Engines Vents from the menu.

2. In the Ventilation, View Engines Vents menu, you will see a list of all of your engines. To view the ventilation for a specific engine, select that engine from the list and click on the Ventilation button to open the ventilation window for that engine.

3. The ventilation window will show you all of the information about your engine’s ventilation system. You can view the current ventilation settings, see how much air is flowing into and out of your engine, and see a graphical representation of how your engine is ventilating.

4. To change the ventilation settings for an engine, click on the Ventilation button and select Edit Ventilation from the menu that appears. The Edit Ventilation window will open, and you can set the ventilation settings for your engine using the controls in this window.

5. To view information about a specific vent in your engine’s ventilation system, click on that vent in the ventilation window and then click on the Info button to open the Info window for that vent. The Info window will show you information about that particular vent, such as its location in your engine, its size, and its airflow rate.

Sub Menu: View Main Vents

To use the Ventilation, View Main Vents menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:

1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

2. Click on the Ventilation, View Main Vents icon.

3. The Ventilation, View Main Vents menu will appear.

4. Select the desired ventilation type from the list.

5. Click on the desired ventilation button to open the corresponding window.

6. Use the buttons on the window to adjust the ventilation settings.

Sub Menu: View Cabin Vents

The Ventilation, View Cabin Vents menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to configure and control your vessel's ventilation system. You can choose from a variety of ventilation options, including fan speed, air volume, and room temperature. You can also set up automatic ventilation schedules to ensure that your cabin remains at a comfortable temperature throughout the voyage.

Menu: Tanks

The Tanks menu on the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to manage their tanks and vessels in a variety of ways. Users can view their tanks' information, including tank contents, tank pressure, and tank temperature; set up alerts for when specific conditions are reached; and generate reports. Additionally, users can access Vessel Management Software features such as vessel scheduling, vessel tracking, and vessel management.

Sub Menu: View Main Fuel Tank

1. Open the Tanks view in the Vessel Management Software.
2. Click on the Main Fuel Tank icon to open the menu.
3. On the Main Fuel Tank menu, click on the View Main Fuel Tank button to open the main fuel tank view.
4. On the main fuel tank view, you can see the current fuel level, total fuel used, and remaining fuel capacity. You can also see the status of each fuel line (active, inactive, or blocked).

Sub Menu: View Secondary Fuel Tank

The Tanks menu can be accessed by selecting the "View Secondary Fuel Tank" option from the Vedere Vessel Management Software. This will open the secondary fuel tank view screen. On this screen, you will be able to select the tank you want to view and then select the data fields you want to view.

Menu: Conning

The Conning menu is a powerful tool that Vedere Vessel Management Software provides to help you manage your vessel. The Conning menu includes tools for navigation, vessel tracking, and data management.

To use the Conning menu, first open the menu by clicking on the icon in the top left corner of the screen. Then click on Conning. The Conning menu will appear.

To navigate your vessel, first click on Navigation. The Navigation menu will appear.

To track your vessel, first click on Tracking. The Tracking menu will appear.

To manage your data, first click on Data Management. The Data Management menu will appear.

Sub Menu: View Wind

The Conning, View Wind menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to view wind data from a number of different sources, including the Vedere Vessel Management System. This information can be used to help optimize vessel operations.

Sub Menu: View Air Temperature

The Conning, View Air Temperature menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to view and manage air temperature data for your vessel. The menu includes tools to view current air temperature, historical air temperature data, and forecast air temperature data. You can also use the menu to set up alerts if the air temperature reaches a specific threshold.

Sub Menu: View Water Temperature

To use the Conning, View Water Temperature menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:

1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

2. On the left side of the screen, click on the Conning, View Water Temperature menu.

3. On the Conning, View Water Temperature menu, you will see three options: Vessel Status, Vessel Data, and Vessel Settings.

4. In the Vessel Status section, you can view information about your vessel, such as its name and location.

5. In the Vessel Data section, you can view information about your vessel's current water temperature and other data related to your vessel's status.

6. In the Vessel Settings section, you can adjust various settings for your vessel, such as its speed and heading.

Sub Menu: View Position

1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software and select the Conning, View Position menu.
2. In the Conning, View Position window, select the desired view position from the drop-down list.
3. To change the view direction, click on the arrow buttons located to the right of the view direction field.
4. To zoom in or out, use the slider bar located at the bottom of the window.
5. To move around in the view, use the cursor keys.

Sub Menu: View Depth

The Conning, View Depth menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to control the view depth of your vessel from a single screen. The view depth can be adjusted by dragging the slider on the left side of the screen. You can also change the view depth by clicking on one of the icons on the toolbar.

Sub Menu: View Depth below Keel

1. Open the Conning, View Depth below Keel menu by clicking on the Conning, View Depth below Keel icon on the Navigation Panel.

2. In the Conning, View Depth below Keel menu, click on Vedere Vessel Management Software.

3. In the Vedere Vessel Management Software window, click on the Vessel Management tab.

4. In the Vessel Management tab, under Navigation, click on the View Depth below Keel button.

5. The View Depth below Keel window will open. In this window, you can view and manage your vessel's view depth below keel.

Sub Menu: View Rudder Position

The Conning, View Rudder Position menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to view and change the rudder position of your vessel. The menu is accessed by clicking on the "Conning, View Rudder Position" button on the toolbar. The following options are available:

- View Rudder Positions: This option displays a list of all available rudder positions for your vessel. You can select a desired rudder position by clicking on it. The selected position will be highlighted in blue.

- Change Rudder Position: This option allows you to change the rudder position of your vessel. To change the rudder position, click on the arrow next to the desired position and drag it to the new location. The selected position will be highlighted in blue. Note that you cannot move the rudder beyond its limits (the red line).

- Save Rudder Position: This option allows you to save the current rudder position of your vessel. To save the current rudder position, click on the arrow next to the desired position and drag it to the save location (a folder on your computer). The selected position will be highlighted in blue.

Sub Menu: View Navigator Lights

The Conning, View Navigator Lights menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to control the navigation lights of their vessel. The menu is accessed by clicking on the "Navigation" tab in the toolbar and then selecting "Conning, View Navigator Lights." This will open the Conning, View Navigator Lights menu. The first item on the menu is the "Lights" button. This button will allow users to toggle between the normal navigation lights and the auxiliary navigation lights. The second item on the menu is the "Auto" button. This button will automatically turn on the navigation lights when the user clicks on it. The third item on the menu is the "Off" button. This button will turn off the navigation lights. The fourth item on the menu is the "On" button. This button will turn on the navigation lights. The fifth item on the menu is the "Color" button. This button will allow users to change the color of the navigation lights. The sixth item on the menu is the "Blink" button. This button will blink the navigation lights. The seventh item on the menu is the "Strobe" button. This button will strobe the navigation lights. The eighth item on her menu is t he "Position" button. This button will display information about how far away from shore each of your navigation lights are positioned.

Menu: Fire Fighting

The Fire Fighting menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to manage their firefighting resources, including crew assignments and vessel location. The menu also provides information on firefighting equipment and firefighting tactics.

Sub Menu: View Pump Room Fans

The Fire Fighting, View Pump Room Fans menu can be accessed by clicking on the "Pump Room" tab in the Vedere Vessel Management Software. From here, users can select the pump room they wish to view and click on the "Fans" button. This will open the Fire Fighting, View Pump Room Fans menu. From here, users can select the type of fan they wish to view (e.g., centrifugal fan, axial fan), the type of pump they are using (e.g., manual pump, electric pump), and the date/time they wish to view the data. The data displayed will include information such as speed, RPM, and blade angle.

Sub Menu: View Fuel Trim Pumps

To use the Fire Fighting, View Fuel Trim Pumps menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software:
1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software.
2. Click on the Fire Fighting, View Fuel Trim Pumps menu.
3. In the Fire Fighting, View Fuel Trim Pumps menu, select the desired pump(s) to view fuel trim data for.
4. Click on the desired pump(s) to view fuel trim data for.
5. Review the fuel trim data for the selected pump(s).
6. If necessary, make adjustments to the fuel trim data for the selected pump(s).

Sub Menu: View Firefight Engine

The Fire Fighting, View Firefight Engine menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to access a variety of tools and functions related to firefighting and vessel management. The main features of this menu include:

-The ability to view current vessel conditions and status information, including fuel levels, engine performance, and environmental readings.
-The ability to manage fires and emergency response operations from a centralized location.
-The ability to create firefighting plans and schedules, track crew performance, and receive real-time updates on vessel operations.

Sub Menu: View Foam System

The Fire Fighting, View Foam System menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software can be used to view and manage the foam system on a vessel. The menu can be accessed by clicking on the Fire Fighting icon in the toolbar of the Vedere Vessel Management Software. The Fire Fighting, View Foam System menu has several options. The first option is Foam Level. This option allows you to view the foam level on a vessel. The foam level can be displayed as a percentage or as a number. The second option is Foam Dispenser. This option allows you to view the status of the foam dispensers on a vessel. The foam dispensers can be displayed as On/Off or In Use. The third option is Foam Tank. This option allows you to view the status of the foam tanks on a vessel. The foam tanks can be displayed as On/Off or Empty. The fourth option is Foam Pump. This option allows you to view the status of the foam pumps on a vessel. The foam pumps can be displayed as On/Off or Running. The fifth option is Foam Tank Pressure Gauge. This option allows you to view the pressure of the foam tanks on a vessel. The pressure of the foam tanks can be displayed as Inch Hg or Bar Hg.

Menu: Generators

The Generators menu in the Vedere Vessel Management Software is used to generate reports and alerts. Reports can be generated on a variety of vessel data, including vessel speed, heading, position, and other information. Alerts can be generated when certain conditions are met, such as a vessel exceeding a set speed or heading.

Sub Menu: View Main

The Vedere Vessel Management Software has a main menu that includes the following:
1. View Vessel Status
2. View Vessel History
3. View Vessel Reports
4. Manage Vessels
5. Export Vessel Data
6. Import Vessel Data
7. Connect to Other Applications
8. Help

Sub Menu: View Backup

The Generators menu item allows you to generate a backup of your vessel's data. The View Backup menu item allows you to view the contents of the backup.

Menu: Batteries

The Batteries menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to view and manage your vessel's battery status, including charging, discharging, and capacity. You can also configure your vessel's battery management settings.

Sub Menu: View current Voltage

1. Open the Batteries menu by clicking on the battery icon in the toolbar.

2. The Batteries menu will open with a list of all your batteries. You can see the current voltage, capacity, and type of battery.

3. To view the Voltage menu, click on the Voltage icon in the toolbar. This will open a new window with different voltage options.

4. To change the voltage, click on the desired value in the window and then click on OK to close it.

Sub Menu: View usage History

To view the usage history of batteries in your Vedere Vessel Management Software, open the View usage History menu and select the Battery usage tab. The Usage History table will list the battery's name, voltage, capacity, and cycle count.

Menu: CCTV

The CCTV menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to view and manage your vessel's CCTV footage. You can access the CCTV menu by clicking on the "Vedere" button in the top left corner of the Vedere Vessel Management Software main window. The CCTV menu will open and you will be able to select which footage you want to view. You can watch footage in real time or save it for later use.

Sub Menu: Manage Bow Camera

The CCTV menu is accessed by pressing the 'C' key on your keyboard and selecting the 'CCTV' option. The main menu will appear and you can select the function you require, such as viewing live footage, recording footage or accessing saved footage. To access the Manage Bow Camera menu, press the 'M' key on your keyboard and select 'Vessel Management'. The Manage Bow Camera menu will appear and you can select the camera you wish to use. You can also change the settings for the camera, such as resolution and frame rate.

Sub Menu: Manage Stern Camera

The CCTV is a security camera that records footage. To use the CCTV, you first need to connect it to your computer. You can do this by either using the supplied USB cable or by connecting it to an external monitor. Once the CCTV is connected, you can access its footage by opening the Vedere Vessel Management Software and clicking on the CCTV icon. The CCTV will then start recording footage. To manage the CCTV's footage, you first need to open the Manage Stern Camera menu. This menu contains all of the CCTV's settings, such as its resolution, frame rate, and quality. You can also adjust the CCTV's volume and brightness. Finally, you can save or export the footage to your computer.

Sub Menu: Manage Port Camera

The CCTV menu in Vedere Vessel Management Software can be used to manage port camera feeds. This includes setting up alerts, viewing footage, and making recordings.

Sub Menu: Manage Starboard Camera

1. Open the Vedere Vessel Management Software and click on the "Camera" tab.

2. Click on the "Manage Starboard Camera" button to open the menu.

3. You can use the following options to manage your camera:

- Change View: You can change the view of your camera by selecting one of the available views. The available views are "Front", "Aft", "Bridge", and "Outside".

- Zoom In/Out: You can zoom in or out to view more or less detail of what is happening in your camera's view.

- Toggle Camera: You can toggle your camera on or off.

Menu: Diagnostic

The Diagnostic menu with the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows users to view detailed information about their vessels, including water temperature, pressure, and other vessel data. This information can be used to troubleshoot problems with your vessels or optimize their performance.

Sub Menu: Perform Self Test

The Diagnostic, Perform Self Test menu allows the user to perform a self-test of their Vedere Vessel Management Software. The self-test includes a variety of questions that help the user to become familiar with the functionality of the software. After completing the self-test, the user can view their results and make any necessary corrections.

Sub Menu: Execute soft reset

There are a few ways to reset the device. The easiest way is to use the Diagnostic menu in the Vedere Vessel Management Software. This will reset all of the device's settings to their default values.

Sub Menu: Execute hard reset

To access the Diagnostic menu, press and hold the power button until the phone turns off. Then, press and hold the volume down button until the phone turns on again. After it turns on, release both buttons. From the main screen, press and hold the home button until you see the diagnostics menu. To access the Execute hard reset menu, press and hold the power button and volume down button at the same time until you see a black screen with a white triangle in the middle. Then, release both buttons. To confirm your selection, press and hold the power button again to select it. Press and hold the volume down button again to select "yes" if you want to execute the hard reset. If you want to cancel or return to the previous menu, press and hold both buttons until you see "back" onscreen.

Menu: Alarms

The Alarms menu allows you to configure and manage alarms for the Vedere Vessel Management Software. You can create alarms to notify you when certain conditions are met, or to trigger automatic actions.

Sub Menu: View Emergency Alarms

The Alarms menu in Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to view and manage your emergency alarms. To access the Alarms menu, click on the "Alarms" tab in the main toolbar. The Alarms menu will open and list all of your installed emergency alarms. You can view the status of each alarm, add new alarms, or delete existing alarms. You can also access the Alarms menu by clicking on the "Emergency Alarms" button on the Home page of Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Sub Menu: View all Alarms

The Alarms menu in the Vedere Vessel Management Software allows you to view all alarms that have been set up on the vessel, as well as to delete any alarm.

Sub Menu: Reset all Alarms

The Alarms menu lets you configure and manage your alarms.
To reset all alarms, open the Vedere Vessel Management Software and select Alarms from the main menu. On the Alarms page, click Reset All Alarms.

How to setup the Wifi on the device.

To set up the wifi for Vedere Vessel Management Software:

1. Launch the Vedere Vessel Management Software.

2. Click on the Settings tab.

3. Under Wifi, click on the Connect button.

4. Enter your wifi password and click on the OK button.

5. You should now see the list of available networks. Select your network and click on the Connect button.

Troubleshooting.

If you are having trouble with the Vedere Vessel Management Software, there are a few things you can do to troubleshoot the issue:

1. Make sure you have installed the software correctly. The installation process is simple and should only take a few minutes.

2. If you are using the software on a desktop computer, make sure that your computer has enough memory and processing power to run the software. The software can be quite resource intensive and may not work properly if your computer is not powerful enough to handle it.

3. Try reinstalling the software if you are having trouble getting it to work. Sometimes installing the software on a different computer or on a different version of Windows can help resolve issues with the software.

4. If you are still experiencing problems with the software, try contacting customer service for assistance. They may be able to help troubleshooting the issue or provide you with a temporary workaround until a new update is released that fixes the problem.

Release notes for version 1.

14

- Importing vessel data now works with accurate dimensions
- Fixed an issue where vessel data would be imported multiple times
- Fixed an issue where vessel data could not be exported to a text file

Related parts.

Console Panels
Alarm System Panel
Marine PC
Trackball
Trackpad
CCTV Cameras
PLC Controllers

createWordDocument

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:0.8
Length:500

Product Information sheet for: Vedere Vessel Management Software (Version: 1), model: Mercury.

Description.

Vedere Vessel Management Software is a software application that helps vessels manage their vessel operations. The software includes features such as vessel tracking, management reports, and compliance monitoring.

Overview.

Supports Multiple Platforms (Windows, Linux)
Connect to PLC Control Processors
Communicate using NMEA2000 networking
Create and view multiple Operator Panels
Swipe and zoom to pages or the alarm list
4 layers of additional data can be viewed for each panel
Use additional photos for each connected device to easily identify your asset
Available for Commercial Ships, Mega Yachts, Navy Ships
Integrate with ISV (Internet Ship View) for remote communication

Highlights.

Supports Multiple Platforms (Windows, Linux)

The Vedere Vessel Management Software supports multiple platforms in two ways. First, it can be used to manage vessels on Windows and Linux computers. Second, it can be connected to remote vessel management systems that are also supported on Windows and Linux. This allows you to manage vessels from anywhere in the world.

Connect To Plc Control Processors

The feature allows you to connect to plc control processors in the Vedere vessel management software. When connected, the control processors provide real-time data for vessel performance and status. This information can be used to make decisions about vessel operations.

Communicate Using Nmea2000 Networking

The feature allows users of the Vedere Vessel Management Software to communicate with vessels using NMEA2000 technology. This enables users to monitor vessel status and performance, as well as exchange data with other vessels using the NMEA2000 network.

Create And View Multiple Operator Panels

The feature allows you to create multiple operator panels in the Vedere Vessel Management software. This can be useful if you want to divide the screen between different users, or if you want to keep track of different parts of your vessel simultaneously.

Swipe And Zoom To Pages Or The Alarm List

This feature allows users to swipe and zoom to pages or the alarm list in the Vedere Vessel Management Software. This allows users to more easily navigate through the software.

4 Layers Of Additional Data Can Be Viewed For Each Panel

This feature allows users to view 4 additional layers of data for each panel in the Vedere vessel management software. This allows users to better understand the operations of their vessels and make intelligent decisions based on data analysis.

Use Additional Photos For Each Connected Device To Easily Identify Your Asset

This feature allows you to use additional photos for each connected device in the Vedere Vessel Management software. This will help you easily identify your asset in the software.

Available For Commercial Ships, Mega Yachts, Navy Ships

The feature allows commercial ships and mega yachts to have their navigation data captured and managed in the Vedere Vessel Management software. This data can include position, heading, speed, course, and other information needed for safe navigation. The feature is also compatible with navy ships, allowing them to use the same software to manage their navigation data.

Integrate With Isv (Internet Ship View) For Remote Communication

The feature allows users to connect to Vedere Vessel Management software via the Isv interface for remote communication. This allows for updates, troubleshooting and other operations to be performed from a remote location.

Related parts.

Console Panels
Alarm System Panel
Marine PC
Trackball
Trackpad
CCTV Cameras
PLC Controllers

Problem

I need a fix for the device is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Atlas Hayden.

Symptoms

The device is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. It will not move or transfer data.

Comment

The server is not responding. The device may be stuck because of internet outage or hardware problem. Try rebooting the device and check whether the issue occurs again. If it does, try troubleshooting from the device itself.

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Atticus Branch.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Atticus Branch.

Symptoms

Unfortunately, I am experiencing a blank screen on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. I've tried reinstalling the software and repairing it, but no luck. Can you provide me a solution? Thank you for your time!

Comment

There could be a few things that are causing the blank screen on Vedere Vessel Management Software. It is important to first check if anything has been updated recently and make sure your internet connection is stable. If all of those checks pass, then you may need to try resetting the software by signaling it with an erase resets self command. Finally, if those steps fail then you can contact Vedere Support for further assistance.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:i have a blinking alarm
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:I need a fix for [KEYWORD] on my [PRODUCT]. Regards, Aubree Williams.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: I need a fix for i have a blinking alarm on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Aubree Williams.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for i have a blinking alarm on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Aubree Williams.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for i have a blinking alarm on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Aubree Williams.

Symptoms

I have a blinking alarm on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. The alarm is supposed to tell me when the vessel has departed maintenance, but it keeps blinking even though the vessel supposedly departed maintenance hours ago. I need a fix for this problem.

Comment

A blinking alarm on a vessel software can be an indicator of one or more issues. First, it could mean that the software isn't installed properly or there's a communication issue between the software and the alarm system. If this is the case, we would recommend contacting our customer support team for further assistance. Alternatively, the alarm may be indicating that something is wrong with the vessel itself. For example, if part of the engine fails and causes the alarm to activate, then we would need to inspect and fix the engine as soon as possible in order to prevent further instrumentation problems.

Problem

Symptoms

Vedere Vessel Management Software (VMS) alarms can be reset by following these steps:


1. Created an account on the Vedere website.

2. Navigated to the company's "Management" page and clicked on the "Alarms" tab.

3. Listed the alarm in question, and then clicked on the "Reset" link next to it.

4. Updated information as needed, and then clicked "Submit."

Hello,

I am a user of Vedere Vessel Management Software and I need a fix for how do I change the alarm boundaries on my software.

My software has an "Alarm Settings" section that allows me to set alarm boundaries for certain areas of the ship, however, I am not able to edit these boundaries to extend past the outer edge of the boat. For example, if I want to set an alarm for the engine room, I am only allowed to set the boundary up to the cockpit window, which is very inconvenient because the engine room is far away from the cockpit. As another suggestion, you could try looking into purchasing an upgraded version of our software that would include additional features like increased boundary limits. Alternatively, if you have any Technical Support questions or issues relating to our software, we would be happy to assist you further. Thank you for your time and attention!
