I need a fix for how to remove an existing device on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Aurora Palmer.

Symptoms

We need a "fix" for how to remove an existing device on our Vedere Vessel Management Software. Unfortunately, there is no clear or straightforward method for doing so. Consequently, we've been struggling to find a solution to this issue for some time now. We've gone through various tutorials and online guides, but we still cannot seem to locate the proper steps or methods for removing the device. In the meantime, our users are constantly having to struggle with this inconvenience and bottleneck. Please help us resolve this problem as soon as possible. Thank you in advance!

We have looked through various online guides and tutorials, but we still cannot seem to find the correct steps or methods for doing so. At this time, removal of an existing device is a manual process that take some users some time to complete. Therefore, we would like to ask our users to please be patient as we work on resolving this issue. Thank you for your understanding and patience.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:my conning display is stuck
Boat:Mercury

I need a fix for my conning display is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Austin Hensley.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for my conning display is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Regards, Austin Hensley.

Symptoms

Austin Hensley has been working on a project wire frame called Vedere Vessel Management Software but was confronted with an unexpected problem - the conning display on his computer screen was stuck on the same images for the past several hours. He needs a fix for this issue as it's prevented him fromcreating or modifying wire frames entirely.

Comment

Hi there Austin. This sounds like something that might be solved with a fix for KB article 3982696- which is an issue affecting crops and livestock managers caused by errors when editing networkconfig file. if you haven't done so already, I'd recommend readingthat article to determine if that's the issue and provide any other details about your project that may help us troubleshoot the problem. Thanks!

Obviously, this was remedied after receiving feedback from users like yourself. Nonetheless, if you ever encounter any issues with the software or need help ACN working it properly, please do not hesitate to reach out to us. We want to ensure that Vedere Vessel Management Software is up to your standards!

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:how can i reset an alarm for a device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD]. Thanks, Averi Anthony.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how can i reset an alarm for a device. Thanks, Averi Anthony.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how can i reset an alarm for a device. Thanks, Averi Anthony.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how can i reset an alarm for a device. Thanks, Averi Anthony.

Symptoms

The Vedere Vessel Management Software includes an alarm management tool that allows users to reset alarms for devices. To reset alarms on a Mercury Xenon device, follow these steps:

1. Activate the alarm by entering the command "/alrm" at the command line.
2. Review the pending alarms and find the alarmed device(s) by executing the command "/alrmd".
3. Use the "reset" option on the alarm for each device to reset its alarms.

Comment

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:how do i change the alarm boundaries
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD]. Thanks, Averi Leblanc.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries. Thanks, Averi Leblanc.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries. Thanks, Averi Leblanc.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries. Thanks, Averi Leblanc.

Symptoms

When using Vedere Vessel Management Software on a Mercury, the alarm boundaries can be modified by opening the software and clicking on Setup -> Adjust Alarms -> Boundaries. This will open a pop-up box with boundaries that can be copied/pasted into another window to modify as needed.

Comment

Once boundaries have been set, launch Vedere Vessel Management Software as usual and select Setup -> Alarms -> Boundaries to check the newly created boundaries.

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how to reset the software. Thanks, Avery Garcia.

Symptoms

I am having difficulty resetting the software on my mercury device.

Comment

If your device is still under warranty, please Contact Mercury so that they can troubleshoot and reset the device for you. Otherwise, please try these steps: Turn off the power to your device Disconnect the power cord from the back of the device Plug in a sreset cable Reconnect the power cord String the startup reset

If these steps do not work, please Contact Mercury and describe the problem so they can help you troubleshoot.

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, my conning display is stuck. Thanks, Royal Avery.

Symptoms

If you are using Vedere Vessel Management Software to control your Mercury Spirit vessel, and the conning display is stuck, then first try deleting all of the old data in the software and re-initializing it. If that does not work, then you may need to reboot your computer.

Comment

Our software updates automatically, so try restarting your computer or deleting all of the old data in the software and re-initializing it to reset it.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Avery Sweeney.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Avery Sweeney.

Symptoms

I am having a problem on my Mercury where the conning display is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. I have tried many different things to try and fix it, but nothing seems to work. Please help!

Comment

There could be several reasons why the conning display is shutting down the vessel management software application. It is possible that there is a problem with the Mercury's motherboard, power supply, or ventilation system. In order to determine the source of the problem, you will need to do some diagnostics. If the problem is with the Mercury's motherboard, you may need to replace the circuit board. If the problem is with the power supply, you may need to replace the power supply unit. If the problem is with the ventilation system, you may need to replace one or more fans.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Aviana Livingston.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Aviana Livingston.

Symptoms

Issue:

Cameras on the stern of my Mercury are freezing and shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

1. Have you installed the latest updates for the camera software? This can help keep the cameras operating properly.
2. Do you have any nearby heat sources? For example, an induction cooktop or CAC unit might warm up the camera internal components and prevent them from freezing.
3. If all else fails, you can try swapping out the camera cables or hard drives - one of which may be malfunctioning.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Oakley Avila.

Symptoms

The Mercury has an alarm installed that shuts down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application if it goes off for more than 10 minutes. This problem occurred because I accidentally hit the "disable all alarms" button instead of the "disable this alarm only" button. I can now disable the alarm, but it is still shutting down the software.

Comment

If you accidentally hit the "disable all alarms" button, then in order to reset the alarm you will need to disable it from the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, navigate to "Settings" on your computer, and then "System Services." After disabling the alarm, save your changes.

Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Ariel Baldwin.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Ariel Baldwin.

Symptoms

This Mercury question is about a problem with the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. When you try to configure the software, it's shutting down the application.

Comment

There could be a few reasons why Vedere Voyager is shutting down the application. First, it's possible that you don't have the latest software or patches installed. If you're having trouble configuring the software, make sure you're running the latest patches and software. Second, you may have incorrect settings on your computer. Check to see if you're running the software in compatibility mode for your operating system or device. Third, there may be a problem with your Vessel Management Software license. Try contacting Vedere customer service for help configuring the software.

Temp:1.2

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Barrett Dean.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Barrett Dean.

Symptoms

Hello,

I am having trouble with my Mercury. When I try to remove an old device from my computer, the Vessel Management Software application crashes. Is there a way to fix this? Thank you very much for your help.

Comment





Dear User,

Thank you for reaching out to us. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and would be happy to help with resolving any difficulties you may be experiencing. If removing an old device from your computer is causing the Vessel Management Software application to crash, it would likely be due to an interaction between the old device and your computer; we recommend uninstalling any software that is not strictly necessary for using your Mercury. If this does not Studio Manager v2 uninstall Mercury and reinstall, it might be helpful to backup your files and data before proceeding, just in case something goes wrong. In any case, do not hesitate to reach out again should you need further assistance.

Sincerely,

The Mercury Team

Symptoms

Select one problem area:

The installation of a new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

This is usually caused by an outdated antivirus programme hindering the operation of Vedere Vessel Management Software. If this is the case, it is possible to uninstall the antivirus and reinstall Vedere Vessel Management Software, as well asupdate its virus definitions.

One common occurrence is that new Menntury's may exhibit instability of the app. Either update the software or fix the app! We apologize for any inconvenience.

Problem

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Anika Bean.

Symptoms

The stern CCTV is disabled, and the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is shutting down.

Comment

There is good news and bad news. The bad news is that the stern CCTV is disabled, which means that you will not be able to keep track of what is happening on your vessel from a security standpoint. However, fortunately there are other ship management software applications available that can be used in place of Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the alarm is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Gianluca Beard.

Symptoms

We have trouble restarting the alarms that keep shutting down the software. Can you help?

Comment

The most common cause of this problem is that the alarm settings are too sensitive and keep shutting down the software. We recommend making your alarm settings softer by adjusting the threshold amount. Additionally, you may also need to make sure that your computer is properly shut down (fully powered off) before restarting the software.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: adding a new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Tatum Beasley.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: adding a new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Tatum Beasley.

Symptoms

When I try to add a new device, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application shuts down.

Comment

There could be a few things going on here. First, are you sure the device is compatible with Vedere Vessel Management Software? Make sure you are using the latest version and that all of the required components are installed. If you are certain the device is compatible, it may be that your Wifi or internet connection is unstable, or that your computer's resources are too busy to communicate with Vedere Vessel Management Software. If you have tried different Wifi networks and still experience issues, it may be necessary to reset your computer's network settings. Finally, make sure you are signed into your Vedere Vessel Management Software account and are authorizing the device when prompted.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Beau Smith.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Beau Smith.

Symptoms

Every now and then, the alarms in the Vedere Vessel Management Software application will shut down the entire application. Resetting the alarms does not seem to help. I am having trouble diagnosing what is causing the problem.

Comment

There could be many reasons for alarm shutdown – from a faulty alarm, invalid alarm configuration input, or events outside the application’s control. In order to identify the cause and resolve the issue, svms support must be able to access specific alarms and data that is not readily available outside of the context of the closed application. For example, alarms customized by users for specific use cases would likely be less accessible and difficult to reconstruct.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:disable the engines
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application. Regards, Bella Avila.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the engines is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bella Avila.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the engines is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bella Avila.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the engines is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bella Avila.

Symptoms

The Vedere Vessel Management Software application is shutting down because the engines are disabled. This can be fixed by turning on the engines.

Comment

This is an error that may be occurring if the Service Engine 3 (ASE)portion of your engine control module is not operational. Service engine 3 is a part of the automobiles computerized maintenance management system. It helps keep critical engine workings going even if other systems are down. To try to fix this issue:

1. Make sure ALL air filters (inside and outside the car) are clean and replaced as prescribed by your mechanic/volume dealer. Gases from dirty air filters will cause VMS to disable one or more engines/ pneumatics because they can overpollute the cleaner lines."

2. Test drive your car with all doors open to allow fresh intake air into the motor. Close allwindows but ONE to help pull fumes out the car."
3. If all three suggestions do not fix the problem, then Service Engine 3 has probably failed, and you will need automobile repairs or a new engine."

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: removing an old device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Belle Lawson.

Symptoms

I am having a problem with my vessel management software quitting when I try to remove an old device. Someone told me that I need to disable theFAX service on the device, but I can't find how to do that.

Comment

The easiest way to fix this problem is to make sure your vessel management software is updated. If you're using a third-party asset management software, be sure to check for updates. Alternatively, you can disable the FAX service on the device. You can disable the FAX service by going to the settings menu and selecting "FAX." From here, you can choose to disable or change the setting on the device.

Problem

How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Benjamin Doyle.

Symptoms

This is a problem with the Vedere Vessel Management Software that needs to be fixed. The software is shutting down when it needs to be in the fire fighting mode.

Comment

Dear Customer,

We are sorry to hear that you are having problems with your Vedere Vessel Management Software. We would like to help you fix the issue as quickly as possible.

In order to maximize the efficacy of the software, it is important that it be in the fire fighting mode at all times. When the software shuts down unexpectedly, this is not a desirable outcome and can restrict its ability to manage your vessels effectively. We apologize for any inconvenience caused by this issue and we would be grateful if you could let us know when you experience it so that we can investigate and resolve it as soon as possible.

Thank you for your time and patience,
The Vedere Team

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Chad Bennett.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Chad Bennett.

Symptoms

The Mercury windscreen freezes when attempting to access the Universal Naval Ship Management System's "Vedere Vessel Management Software" application. I've attempted to reset the computer, update drivers, uninstall and reinstall both software and explorer, change the memory parameters, clear all history, cache, and cookies - with no luck.

Comment

There could be a number of potential causes for this problem, some of which include:

-The Mercury windscreen might not have been updated recently, which could result in it not recognizing or working with certain online applications.
-This problem could also be caused by a lack of drivers or software needed to access the Universal Naval Ship Management System's "Vedere Vessel Management Software" application.
-Another possible underlying issue could be accessibility issues with the Universal Naval Ship Management System's "Vedere Vessel Management Software" application itself. If you are unable to access this software through the Mercury windscreen, please contact your operating system administrator or supported software vendor for assistance.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software

Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is freezing the [PRODUCT] application. Thank you, Bentlee Singleton.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Bentlee Singleton.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Bentlee Singleton.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Bentlee Singleton.

Symptoms

I am having issues with my Mercury freezing while I'm using the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Whenever I attempt to disable the CCTV on the stern, it consistently freezes up on me and I have to restart my computer. This problem has been occurring more and more frequently and I'm starting to worry that it might be causing some sort of damage to my computer. Would you happen to know how I can solve this problem? Thank you for your time.

Comment

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out to us about your Mercury freezing issue. We are sorry to hear that this is happening and can testify that it can be frustrating. Thank you for taking the time to fill out this survey so that we may get to the bottom of what might be causing the problem.

If you are experiencing continuous freezing while disabling CCTV on your stern, it could possibly be caused by a few different things. One possibility is that your computer's hardware might not be capable of handling the increasing load of the CCTV application. Another possibility is that something in your computer's settings might be causing interference with the CCTV feature. If you feel like this is a more general issue with the software rather than something specific to disabling CCTV on your stern, we would recommend revisiting your system's main settings and performance benchmarks to see if any changes can help address any problems that might be causing performance degradation or freezing altogether.

If disabling CCTV on your stern has consistently been causing your computer to freeze or bog down, there may not be a permanent solution available other than replacing your computer. However, some temporary Fixes may include simplifying your antivirus and firewall protection (if applicable), closing any unnecessary programs, adjusting your graphics settings if necessary, and reducing software installed onto your computer. In most cases these steps will help alleviate some latent issues from surrounding programs which may have an extended effect on threshold requirements required for system stability such as stabilising cameras or navigating vessels efficiently

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Benton Walters.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Benton Walters.

Symptoms

My Mercury froze when trying to activate the alarm. I have troubleshooting steps posted on another thread. -"Enable the alarm service by selecting "Local alarm services" from the "Settings">"Display/Screen" menu: On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Benton Walters."

Comment

Your Mercury unit may have a trouble with the alarm service. Sometimes, activating or enabling the alarm service becomes problematic and needs delicate diagnosis. If the problem only occurs sometimes, it is likely that a firmware update for your alarm system may be needed. Updating the firmware on your thermostat or alarm system often resolves complicated issues like this. Unfortunately, if this fix does not work, you may need service from your thermostat or alarm company.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: adding a new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Ivory Best.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: adding a new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Ivory Best.

Symptoms

The Mercury camera owner's manual recommends adding new devices to the device list and rebooting the Mercury so that the Vedere Vessel Management Software application can recognize the new device. However, after following these instructions, the Mercury continues to freeze and cannot be used.

Comment

Error: Camera not recognized. Please add a USB camera or other device to the Mercury camera owner's manual recommends adding new devices to the device list and rebooting the Mercury so that the Vedere Vessel Management Software application can recognize the new device. However, after following these instructions, the Mercury continues to freeze and cannot be used.

To resolve this issue, please remove any new devices you have added to your Mercury Camera and reboot it. Then re-add your device and try using it again. If this still fails to work, please send your Mercury Camera in for repair.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Bjorn Everett.

Symptoms

I have a 2007 Mercury Mountaineer Extractor and the engines have been freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. I have tried disabling all of the engines, but it hasn't fixed the proble. Does anyone know how to fix this?

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Bjorn Rivera.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Bjorn Rivera.

Symptoms

My Mercury is consistently freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, no matter what I do. The software works intermittently, but always freezes after a few minutes of use. This has been going on for months.

Comment

There could be many reasons for why your Mercury is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Here are some possible causes and solutions:

Problem: My Mercury is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application
Solution 1
It is possible that you are experiencing an issue with your Mercury hardware. Try reinstalling your Mercury in a fresh environment to see if that resolves the issue. If not, it may be necessary to upgrade your Mercury's firmware.
Solution 2
It is also possible that your computer is not up to speed when trying to run the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Make sure you have the latest updates available for your computer and software, and that your computer has been modernized with the most recent hardware and software.
If neither of these solutions work, it may be necessary to consult a computer specialist or Udemy instructor to troubleshoot and resolve the issue.

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: installing a brand new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Blaire Dickson.

Symptoms

I have a Mercury Abacus 9650 series desk top computer. Recently, I was given a newdevice (a camera) to install. I tried to install the device, and it is constantly freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Softwareapplication. I have rebooted my computer countless times, and still the application freezes. What can I do to fix this problem?

Comment

There are a few things you can do to try and resolve the issue:  Make sure your computer is up-to-date. Go toHelp > Check for Updates, and follow the instructions to update your software. If you still experience freezing or problems with the software, please contact our customer support team at (844) 504-4405.  Clear your browser cache, cookies, and browsing history. For detailed instructions on how to do this, please see our article on Clearing Your Browsing History & Cache.  Enable pop-ups in your browser settings. This will prevent certain types of notifications fromtriggered automatically when you visit websites. Refer to our article on How to Disable Pop-Ups on Your Browser for more information.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Blaise Fisher.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Blaise Fisher.

Symptoms

I have a 2013 Mercury Optio LS which I've been using for a few months now. Recently, the car started freezing up when trying to enable the "Firefighting Mode." It would just freeze up and I had to wait for it to unfreeze or reset and then try again. This has been happening increasingly frequently, to the point where it's becoming almost unuseable. I've tried deactivating and re-enabling certain services, turning off other useful functions like seat warmers and heaters in order to see if that could workaround the issue, but nothing seems to work. Any ideas on how I can fix this?

Comment

There could be many reasons why the car is freezing up and thefix might vary for each individual instance. However, some common fixes that could work for this problem are to try rebooting your car; clearing any debris or debris buildup on your computer's electrical ports or system board; and check all of youraugmented or add-on hardware and update as needed. If you have a garage/conservation area nearby, freezer burn could also be a potential issue which could lead to freezing up. If you notice your car starting to freeze up more often, please do not hesitate to bring it in for a diagnostic check so that we can identify and correct the underlying issue as soon as possible.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Blakely Barton.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Blakely Barton.

Symptoms

When using the Vedere Vessel Management Software, the conning display intermittently freezes and obstructs functionality. This problem is most noticeable when scrolling through vessel data. In order to fix this issue, Blakely Barton suggests disabling the conning display when not in use:
" 1. Open Settings from the Menu at the top of the screen.
2. Click on General, and then click on Use Onscreen Cursor.
3. Click on the heart icon to the right of Disable When inactive and select Keep inactive when inactive to turn it on.
4. Hit Apply then OK."

Comment

While the symptom of the conning display freezing intermittently is a problem, disabling the display when not in use can help alleviate this issue.

Length:500

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Laney Blanchard.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Laney Blanchard.

Symptoms

The stern CCTV is always freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

1. There could be something wrong with the CCTV, and if that's the case you'll need to have it repaired. If the CCTV is on a network attached device (NAS, router, etc.), then you may also need to troubleshoot and fix the network connection.Once the CCTV is re-checked and working properly, another issue causing FCM to freeze could be present. To troubleshoot and find out the cause of the freezing issue, we recommend running diagnostics associated with Vedere Vessel Management Software: ール Installation, Usage Procedure01 & 02
3.) Seeing that there are currently no updates available for Vedere Vessel Management Software and as freezing is consistently observed with the software, it is recommended to upgrade your software to the latest revision. Upgraded software should fix most reported issuesincluding freezing.

Problem

How do i fix: adding a new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Raina Bonilla.

Symptoms

I have an HP Pavillion G6 laptop that having been added a new USB key containing a RAID volume containing three hard drives. Yesterday I attempted to access the drive partitions on the USB key using "File://IS/VolumeXXX/YEARMMDD/file.ext" which has been working fine for several months. However, this morning when launching Vedere Vessel Management Software it requests that I enter the volume serial number - which I cannot find anywhere. I've tried hitting F1 to get help in the software, but nothing happens. When opening the Related Documents tab in the application, I see from diagnostic data that launch was successful - but when I drill down into the Create or Manage vessel...Result there was an error code thrown and an event Log pointing to E001030 ...which according to memory resident tool kits is associated with 'Failed trying to add device for 301'; however, after reproducing the issue and scanning for solutions online, none of them seem to address my specific problem of being unable to find the serial number on the new device. Is there anything Else I can do?

Comment

You may need to reinstall your HP Pavilion g6 laptop's operating system.

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Neil Bowman.

Symptoms

VIDEREVIZER MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE APPEARS TO BE DEactivating OUR ENGINES WHEN WE CLOSE DOWN THE PROGRAMMERS

Comment

Our team at VIDereviZER understands that it can be frustrating when our management software appears to be deactivating our engines whenever we close down the program. We appreciate your feedback, and we're committed to ensuring that our software works reliably and effectively for our customers.

In order to ensure reliability and effectiveness of our management software, we periodically review and endorse updated engine maintenance protocols. Designed to minimize your time spent on engine maintenance, these updates can help keep your engines operating at peak performance. To learn more about our current engine maintenance protocols and to get detailed information on upcoming updates, please contact our customer support team at 1-855-394-4653 or support@videreviZER.com

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: adding a new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Braxton Ellis.

Symptoms

Hi, I'm Braxton Ellis and I am having a problem with my Mercury. Every time I add a new device, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is reset. Can you help me?

Comment

Thank you for reaching out to us. We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue with the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Could you please give us some more details so that we can help you troubleshoot? If there is an update available for the software, could you scan the serial number of your device to see if there is an available update? Depending on the particulars of your situation, we may be able to remotely assist you with resolving the issue. Thank you for your time and patience as we work to help you resolve this problem.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Brayden Felix.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Brayden Felix.

Symptoms

I'm having problems resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software alarms. When I try to do it through the menu items, nothing happens. I'veIRED the mercury a bunch and it still won't work.

Comment

The problem could be any one of the following:

- The power cord is damaged or disconnected. Try plugging in the power cord and turning on the device. If the problem persists, call customer service.

- There might be a software issue that needs to be corrected. Try resetting the device by selecting "Reset All Alarms" from the menu, and then pressing OK. If there is still a problem, contact customer service.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Braylee Rocha.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I zoom to a different screen in the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, the application resets and I have to start from the beginning.

Comment

I have seen this issue on other computers as well. It might be due to a Windows 10 update that has cause a problem with the Mercury software using Motorola drivers. To fix this, you can disable the updates for the Mercury software and see if that solves the problem.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:disable the engines
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application. Thank you, Braylon Malone.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Braylon Malone.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Braylon Malone.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Braylon Malone.

Symptoms

I'm having trouble getting my Mercury to stop automatically resetting its engines. I've tried everything I can think of, and everything just seems to backfire on me. Every time I try to fix the problem, the engines keep resetting themselves.

According to the original owner's manual, disabling the engines supposedly fixes this problem. However, nothing I've tried so far has worked. The only thing that seems to help is restarting the Mercury but that doesn't always seem to work either.

Comment

Could it be something simple I'm missing?

If the problem is with the Mercury's engines, chances are it might just be a simple thing you're missing. Try etching or grinding the pistons in the engine block to see if that fixes the issue. It's possible that the materials used in these repairs can overheat the engine and cause it to reset. It might also be a good idea to have a mechanic diagnose and fix the problem.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:configure the software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application. Thank you, Brenda Mccall.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Brenda Mccall.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: configure the software is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Brenda Mccall.

Symptoms

I have a 1991 Mercury Topaz 3.0 engine that has 35,00 miles on it. I recently had the software for the vessel management system reset by my mechanic to fix a problem. The mechanic told me that he reset the software because there was something plugged into one of the diagnostics ports and he didn't know what it was. Since then, whenever I try to configure the software, it tells me that it is resetting the application. I have tried unplugging all of the accessories, turning the car off and on again, and doing a troubleshooting scan but I can't seem to get the configuration program to work. Any ideas?

Comment

First, check to make sure all of the wires are plugged in properly and making a connection. Next, connect your ignition coil wire to sparks Conn. Finally, connect 277 Volts to the Ignition Coil Wire Tips (3 prong connector). Turn on your car and allow it to run 30 seconds with the door closed while the engine is idling. If all of this has failed, you may need assistance from your mechanic.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:removing an old device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application. Thank you, Brendan Pugh.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Brendan Pugh.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Brendan Pugh.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: removing an old device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Brendan Pugh.

Symptoms

Your Mercury is seemingly unable to delete an older device from the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Attempting to do so results in theapplication resetting itself, preventing further deletion attempts.

Comment

There could be several reasons why the Mercury is having difficulty deleting an older device from the Vessel Management Software application. First, make sure that the Mercury is connected to the internet and has an active account with Vedere.com. Second, it's possible that the Mercury's firmware hasn't been updated in a while, which can sometimes cause issues with its software. Finally, it's possible that the deletion attempt was attempted while the Mercury was logged into another application (like Vedere Vessel Management Software) and Proxy Settings were enabled. In order to delete an older device from the Vessel Management Software application, disable Proxy Settings.

Symptoms

I've had my MERCURY since 2009 and it's been an incredible vehicle. Recently I fixed my car and now when I try to install a brand-new device, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application keeps resetting. What do I do to fix this?

Comment

Your MERCURY may have a firmware issue that needs to be fixed. Try downloading the latest firmware update from your MERCURY's support website and installing it. If that doesn't solve the problem, you may need to take your MERCURY to an authorized service center for further repairs.

Please follow the steps provided in our Getting Started Guide and attempt to troubleshoot any underlying issues as they may be causing this issue. If you still are not able to resolve the issue, please feel free to contact us for further assistance.

Problem

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Briana Nunez.

Symptoms

The Vedere Vessel Management Software application appears to be disabling the CCTV on the stern of the vessel. This is causing inaccurate readings of compass Rose and speed based navigation constraints. We need to disable the CCTV on the stern so that the software can properly manage navigation constraints.

Comment

Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We will work to have the CCTV disabled on the stern so that the software can more accurately manage navigation constraints.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:enable the alarm
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application. Regards, Briar Harding.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Briar Harding.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Briar Harding.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Briar Harding.

Symptoms

VLMS allows for alarm configuration through the use of programming code. When an alarm threshold is exceeded, the software will execute the code once. Unfortunately, this process can occasionally reset the VLMS application. This creates an issue whereby alarms may go off multiple times consecutively, interrupting normal workflow and ultimately causing unnecessary expense.

Comment

One possible fix for this problem would be to create scripts or programs that would refrain from executing if the alarm threshold had been previously exceeded. Additionally, PSwiata recommends regularly checking alarms and potential reset events to ensure that they are not causing disruptions.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:adding a new device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application. Regards, Briar Hartman.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: adding a new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Briar Hartman.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: adding a new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Briar Hartman.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: adding a new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Briar Hartman.

Symptoms

When adding a new device, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is reset.

Comment

If you wish to add a new device or function to your Vedere Vessel Management Software installation, be sure to first uninstall any other devices or applications from your computer. Once your computer is Shinified, install the Vedere Vessel Management Software app and follow the on-screen instructions. If you find that you have lost control of certain vessel data - such as engine temperature - after installing a new device or function, please ensure you have cleared all user data in the "Vedere Vessel Management Software" Data Storage area. Any customizations made by prior users will also need to be reset. Finally, if you are experiencing any other issues with the software installation or operation, please contact our customer service professionals at 877-265-8868 for assistance.

Length:500

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Briar Mathis.

Symptoms

There has been an issue where resetting the alarms has not been working as intended. Resetting the alarms should properly reset the Vedere Vessel Management Software application and stop any ongoing scheduled system tasks, but this does not always appear to be the case. There may be a problem with the preprogrammed alarm reset sequence that must be identified and repaired.

Comment

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. In order for the alarms to reset, the on/off switch must be turned to "on." If resetting the alarms does not work, please let us know and we will continue to investigate.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:zooming to a different screen
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application. Regards, Bridger Christensen.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bridger Christensen.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bridger Christensen.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bridger Christensen.

Symptoms

I'm having trouble zooming to different screens in my Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Every time I zoom to a different screen, the applicationReset() function is called. This function seems to reset the existing contents of all windows on the current screen and clean up any opened files. This effect is visible even if I swear never to zoom again that particular window until my next save.

I've looked through the source code for the applicationReset() function, but I'm not sure what I need to do to fix this problem. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Comment

There may be a bug in your user interface program that is resetting windows onscreen when zooming. To prevent this, you can restrict zooming to the selected window by setting the zoomtype parameter to "selected". This will cause Vedere Vessel Management Software only to zoom into the designated window.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Bronson Lugo.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Bronson Lugo.

Symptoms

The Mercury Ivy Bridge conning display does not always turn on even when the computer is booting. I have tried loading the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, but it still does not work.

Comment

There could be several potential causes of this problem and it would need to be investigated further in order to confirm the cause. One possibility is that there may be a problem with one of the Mercury Ivy Bridge conning display inputs (such as an animated graphic), or with the electronic circuitry that powers the display. In order to rule out any possible problems, it may be necessary to take your computer into for servicing.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:disable the engines
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application. Thank you, Jay Bryant.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Jay Bryant.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Jay Bryant.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Jay Bryant.

Symptoms

I am having trouble disabling the Mercury engines when the software to control them (Vedere Vessel Management Software) starts up after I power on the vehicle.

Comment

There could be a few things going on. One possibility is that you are trying to do something that the software was not designed to do. Another possibility is that the Mercury engine controllers (or the software that interacts with them) might not have been connecting properly when they first started up. To troubleshoot this, try following these steps: 1. Verify that all power to the vessel is off and then turn it back on. The software should start up automatically. If it does not,try turning off and then back on your computer,your network jack, and your vessels power outlet. 2. Verify that the vessel is plugged into an electrical outlet and see whether any lights come on when you turn on your computer or when you plug in the USB port (port 6).If there are no lights coming on and you have verified that all power is off to the vessel, then you likely have a wiring problem somewhere in your chain of command. In this case, you would need to send an electrician out to diagnose the problem and fix it. 3. Verify that both Mercury engines are turned off by unplugging them from their controller and checking the voltages (mpu voltage converter can be cumbersome to access). When both engines are OFF,the numbers should be within 0.6v-1v of each other (measured between adjacent connections on the mpu circuit boards; ±5%), so malfunctioning amplifier stages or electronic vice-grip levers in one engine could make the voltage jump around quite a bit even though both engines are completely removed from their controllers. 4. Use a reset button (provided with some controllers) which briefly reapplies power to associated devices like radios and sensors for diagnostic purposes; holding down this button for more than 50 ms makes sure ot specifically contacts all associated components internally mounted on offerors during operation 5. Turn each engine ON slowly (and note how long run time each lasts), letting go once running smoothly

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Brysen Torres.

Symptoms

I recently replaced my CV60393A engine in my Mercury Merivacan with a new 2.0L DOHC engine and whenever I attempt to start the car, I get a flashing firefighting (or active protection) light on the instrument cluster and the car will not boot into operating mode. I've tried holding down the start/stop button and turning the key multiple times, but nothing works. I've contacted Mercury support and they told me that I need to initialize the car's computer by pressing the "power" Button 5 times while turning the key to accessory and then press it again to stop. However, when I try doing this, the "error 35" message pops up on the screen. Could someone please help me understand how to fix this issue?

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why your vehicle is not starting. Have you tried holding down the start/stop button and turning the key multiple times before contacting Mercury support? There could also be a problem with the ignition switch, which needs to be replaced. If there is still a problem, you may need to take your car to a mechanic to have it tested.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Colby Buchanan.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Colby Buchanan.

Symptoms

When trying to start the Vedere Vessel Management software, I am getting an error that says "Enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application."

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why you are getting this error message when trying to start the Vedere Vessel Management software. The most common reasons are that either your computer does not have the necessary components or files to run the application, or you may not have installed the correct version of the software. If you are using a Mac, make sure you have the latest version of the VirtualBox Guest Addition installed. If you are using Windows, you may need to install a virtual machine software like VMware or Hyper-V. Additionally, there could be important updates or service packs that need to be installed in order for the software to function correctly. Follow the instructions provided on the Vedere website to see if there are any required updates or service packs that need to be installed.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Monica Burch.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Monica Burch.

Symptoms

The Vedere Vessel Management Software application prevented me from disabling the engines.

Comment

Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to us regarding the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. There can be a few reasons why disabling the engines may not have worked as intended. One possibility is that you may not have properly followed the steps outlined in our documentation. If this is the case, please contact our customer service team for more help.
In addition, it is possible that your vessel's engines are already disabled and you would need to contact your marina or shipping company for assistance in switching them back on. Again, our customer service team would be more than happy to help support you in this process.
We hope that this helps and please do not hesitate to reach out if you encounter any further difficulties.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: configure the software is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Ansley Burch.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: configure the software is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Ansley Burch.

Symptoms

The software is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. However, it appears that some configuration of the software is necessary in order for it to function properly.

Comment

Dear customer,

Thank you for contacting Vedere Vessel Management Software. As your software is booting, it appears that some configuration of the software is necessary in order for it to function properly. In order to assist you with this, we suggest following the instructions located on our website (customercare.vedere-group.com). If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at [redacted] or [redacted].

Sincerely,
Vedere

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Lucille Burch.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Lucille Burch.

Symptoms

I have an old TV that I no longer need. I keep trying to remove it from my computer, but it keeps booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. What can I do to fix this?

Comment

There are a few things that you can do to try and fix this issue. First, try following our instructions on how to remove the Vedere Vessel Management Software application from your computer. If that doesn't work, you can try uninstalling and reinstalling the software. Another possibility is that your old TV is interfering with the Vedere Vessel Management Software program. You can try turning off your old TV and/or trying connecting it to another outlet in your home in order to see if that resolves the issue. Regardless of what solutions you try, please let us know if they don't work so we can further assist you.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the alarm is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Reuben Callahan.

Symptoms

I have a 2000 Mercury Allanté Sedan. Recently, one of the sensors in my car has been renaming itself Whenever I try and turn on the alarm, it tells me that the "enable alarm is erroring" which prevents the alarm from functioning. What can I do to fix this?

Comment

Your 2000 Mercury Allanté Sedan likely has a faulty sensor. In order to fix the issue, you will need to replace the sensor. This can be done through a mechanic or by yourself. You will need to locate the sensor, remove it, and replace it with a new one. Once the sensor has been replaced, re-install the alarm software and test it to ensure that it works correctly.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: zooming to a different screen is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Callum Garza.

Symptoms

Comment

Thank you for reaching out to us. It sounds like you may be having difficulty zoomed in or out on your Mercury screen. Zoomed in works fine, but zoomed out constantly interupts the cycle. We would recommend trying toggling the "window opacity" slider to either the "hidden" or "fully opaque" options if that does not solve the issue. If that does not work, please reach out to our support team for assistance with resolving this issue.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Calvin Brewer.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the engines is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Thank you, Calvin Brewer.

Symptoms

You are using the Mercury 1 computer system to troubleshoot a problem with your Vedere Vessel Management Software application. The problem appears to be that the engines are disabled incorrectly and are crashing the application. There may be a few different remedies for this type of error, but the most likely is to disable the engines manually by entering the command: ´systemdisconnectAllEngines´ into the console. You should also try to refresh the application and reset any corrupted data files. If these measures do not help, you can contact Vedere technical support for more help.

Comment

Thank you for reaching out to us about your Vedere Vessel Management Software issue. One potential remedy for this issue may be to disable the engines manually by entering the command "systemdisconnectAllEngines" into the console. If this does not work, we suggest trying to refresh the application and reset any corrupted data files. If those measures fail, we recommend contacting Vedere technical support for assistance.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: adding a new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Canaan Rosales.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: adding a new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Canaan Rosales.

Symptoms

My company recently upgraded our Vedere Vessel Management Software to the latest version and now when we try to add a new device it is erroring out. The exception thrown for this error is 'The requested action cannot be performed because an ampersand was not found in the name'. We've searched through the docs, looked through forum posts, and even tried reinstalling the software but no luck. Can somebody please give us a direction as to how we can resolve this problem?

Comment

Assuming you're referring to the Device Management Service (DMS), it may be that they have been changed over from a series of ampersands (&) to hyphens (-). To fix this, go into the server's configuration and change the name of the service back to its original format.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:reset the alarms
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application. Regards, Bruce Cannon.

Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: reset the alarms is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bruce Cannon.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: reset the alarms is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bruce Cannon.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: reset the alarms is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Bruce Cannon.

Symptoms

I am having a problem where the alarms are resetting on my Vedere Vessel Management Software application. I have tried to reset the alarms through the software, but it is erroring every time I try to do so.

Comment

Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to us. It sounds like you might be experiencing an issue with your alarms resetting on your Vedere Vessel Management Software application. There are a few things that you can do in order to troubleshoot this problem:

-First, make sure that your computer is running the latest version of the software. If there are newer versions available, please upgrade to the latest version and see if that resolves the issue.

-If the software is still not fixing the alarm issue, it might be worth checking to see if there are any other hardware or software issues that could be causing the alarm resetting. You can try disconnecting and reconnecting your vessel's batteries to see if that clears anything up. Alternatively, you can check to make sure that all of your network cables and tabs are plugged in properly and securely.

We apologize for any inconvenience this may be causing and we will do our best to resolve the issue as soon as possible.

Problem

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Regards, Cara Murphy.

Symptoms

Hello support team,
On 06/06/2017 02:05 PM I attempted to install a brand new device and due to an issue with the Vedere Vessel Management Software application it is erroring every time. I have tried following all necessary steps listed here- https://support.videre. com/hc/en-us/articles/212328607-Connecting-to-the-Vessel-Manager-Software#TroubleshootingInstallingNewDevices However none of these seem to work as the latest device only installs the software once but keeps erasing my configuration every time i try to re-install. How do i permanently fix this without having to uninstall and reinstall each time? Please advise. Thank you in advance.

Comment




Our technician would first need to troubleshoot the device that you are trying to install. Some common issues they might face while installing a new device include dried out cable connections, conflicts with older software products, and corrupted files. Ultimately, it leads to installation errors. Depending on the severity of the issue, installing a NEW device might not be the solution. In some cases, our technicians may need to restore or reset your devices in order to resolve your problem. Further technical guidance would be needed for this specific scenario.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the device is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

I was just trying to close my Vedere Vessel Management Software, but the device is stuck on the "close" icon. I've tried pressing theEsc key, restarting my computer, unplugging and replugging in my laptop, and everything else I can think of. Please help!

Comment

One possibility is that you are experiencing a TPM issue. Try these steps:

- plug in your laptop to an AC outlet and try booting it up again
- if that doesn't work, try holding down the power button until your laptop powers off (most likely means your battery is dead) and then turn it back on
- ensure you have installed the most recent update for your machine

Problem

I need a fix for i have a blinking alarm on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

My Vedere Vessel Management software intermittently stops updating information about my vessel, leading to inaccurate tracking of its location and movement. The alarm icon for the vessel will continuously blink impatience until the update process is completed.

Comment

- The sensor Network Unit or transmission device is faulty and needs to be replaced.
- There may be a problem with the Vessel's Networks that need to be corrected
- Data packets sent by the Vessel are corrupt and need to be inspected/fixed

I need a fix for how to reset the software on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for how to reset the software on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

My Vedere Vessel Management software crashes every time I try to reset it.

Comment

There could be a few reasons why your Vedere Vessel Management software might crash every time you try to reset it. First, make sure that your computer is duly updated and has all the latest security patches installed. Second, make sure that your hard drive is clean and free of any large files or unnecessary programs. Third, try re-loading the program by restarting your computer and running it from the installation disk again. If all of these solutions fail, it might be necessary to take your software off-line for an extended period of time in order to fix its problems.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:how to remove an existing device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:I need a fix for [KEYWORD] on my [PRODUCT].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: I need a fix for how to remove an existing device on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Thanks, Aurora Palmer.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for how to remove an existing device on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for how to remove an existing device on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

I currently have an existing device on my Vedere Vessel Management Software that I need to remove. I am not sure how to do this.

Comment

If your device is registered on Vedere Vessel Management Software, have your user ID and password handy as you will need them to disable the device. If your device is not registered on Vedere Vessel Management Software, follow these steps:

Sign in to your account at http://vedere.com and click 'Account' in the top right hand corner. Enter your user ID and password to sign in. Under ‘My Products’ on the left hand side, click on the product name for which you wish to disable the device. Under ‘Features & Settings’ on the right hand side of the product page, click on ‘Disable Device’ beside the device name. A pop-up will appear asking you to confirm that you wish to disable the device. Click on ‘Disable Device’ to finish disabling the device.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:my conning display is stuck
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:I need a fix for [KEYWORD] on my [PRODUCT].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: I need a fix for my conning display is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software. Thanks, Austin Hensley.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for my conning display is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for my conning display is stuck on my Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Symptoms

The conning display on my Vedere Vessel Management Software is stuck on the "Welcome to your new ship" screen. I have tried resetting the software, changing video resolutions, and pulling the power cord numerous times, but nothing seems to work. Can you help?

Comment

First, it's important to understand that resetting the software might not actually repair the issue. A more complex issue might need a professional technician to resolve. In terms of resolutions, changing video resolutions can often help if the issue is with graphics or icons. Simply adjusting the resolution may free up the screen and allow you to navigation content. Pulling the power cord may work in some cases, but it's not always a definitive fix. If resetting or changing resolutions don't work, check to ensure there are no hidden obstructions blocking the conning display from receiving power. If these don't solve the issue, it may be necessary to have the vessel management software serviced by a professional technician.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:how can i reset an alarm for a device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how can i reset an alarm for a device. Thanks, Averi Anthony.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how can i reset an alarm for a device.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how can i reset an alarm for a device.

Symptoms

resetting alarms is a common problem when using the Vedere Vessel Management Software on Mercury. To reset an alarm: 1. Open Vedere Vessel Management Software. 2. Select the device you want to reset the alarm for. 3. Click the Settings Icon (3 dots in top right corner). 4. Click Alarms. 5. Under Alarm Creditor, click Reset Alarm. 6. Under New Alarm 6, enter the new alarm number and click OK. 7. Repeat steps 2-6 for each alarm you want to reset.

Comment

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries.

Symptoms

The Vedere Vessel Management Software with the Mercury 8400 enclosure has an alarm system that is Boundaries Based. This means that the alarm boundaries are set by landmarks on the equipment. However, sometimes you may want to change the alarm boundaries. There are a few ways to do this.

One way to change the boundaries is to adjust the charts on the TomTomsoftware that controls the alarm. This can be accessed through the "Alarm editor" part of Vedere Vessel Management Studio on your computer. Navigate to "Chart Extremes .... => File Path Setting correspondance" and make the necessary changes to the charts. After making the changes, save your changes and re-launch Vedere Vessel Management Software. The new boundaries will be in effect from now on when you detect an incident.

Another method is to use the Feature Star Buddy feature in Vedere Vessel Management Software. With this feature, you can snap star points anywhere around your equipment and automatically establish new alarm boundaries ascharted stars fall within those bounds. You'll need to create a map before you start using Feature Star Buddy, and then Save it once it's done so you don't have to reenter all of your information each time you want to use it. To access Mode Feature Star Buddy, go to "Features" => Mariners Systemmanagement => Advisories => Feature Star Buddy and follow the on-screen instructions.

Comment

.

(Note: The Feature App may allow you toto manually set boundaries as long, but it is not adapted for this purpose and also has some limitations. For example, it cannot take into account the type of vessel or wind conditions.)
