Instructions can be found online or through specific support tools provided by your computer manufacturer.

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury has a reset alarm feature which will shut down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. To reset the alarm: 1. Open the Mercury's application menu. 2. Select Vehicle Detection. 3. Under Reset Alarm, click the Reset button.

Comment

4. The alarm will be reset and will restart automatically when the vehicle is detected.

Restore your application's original window dimensions by following these directions: 1. Click in the upper right corner of the window to make it focus on your application- this will be highlighted in blue. (Windows 8/10 Users: Hover over the windows start button and click on "Task Manager" located in the bottom of explorer bar). If cannotzooming does not work than proceed to step 2..

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Your Mercury has a disable engine protection feature which shuts down the motors in order to protect them. However, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application (which uses the Mercury's motor engines) won't start up unless the engines are turned on. You can try manually starting the software or restarting your Mercury.

Comment

Depending on the issue, you may be able to start the software or restart your Mercury yourself. If the issue is related to the engine protection feature, your best option may be to contact Mercury customer service for assistance.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:configure the software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix configure the software is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix configure the software is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix configure the software is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Since I got my Merc, I have had problems with the software shutting down. If I am not paying attention it will usually shut down right when I am trying to configure something or add a new vessel. It has been going on for a couple years now and I am just about fed up. Any help would be much appreciated!

Comment

There could be a few potential problems with your Merc software. One possibility is that you may have accidentally clicked on something that inadvertently killed the running of the software. If this is the case, please try turning off all of your computer'sapps, rebooting your computer, and then starting up again manually by choosing "Merc Software" from the Startoption menu. If that doesn't work, possibly neccessary is to call customer service.

Another problem could be a rogue software component. When you first get a new piece of software, there are usually a few things that need to be configured (setting up passwords and user accounts, for example). Some plug-ins or components of the program may not function as they should if they were added at a later date by another user - this can cause the software to suddenly quit working in some circumstances. In order to determine if this is the case, try restarting your Merc software completely (not just closing it down and restarting it), looking through all of your personal settings (including any passwords), and trying to recreate any accidental configurations you may have made. If that fails to solve the problem, then it might be necessary to call customer service.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury device removal helpline tells participants to remove their old device and replace it with a new one, which shuts down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

Managing devices and software can be complicated and time-consuming. Mercury's helpline is designed to provide guidance and support during this process. Participants should remove their old device and replace it with a new one, provided that the new device is compatible with Vedere Vessel Management Software.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the fire fighting mode is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, the enable the fire fighting mode is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

1. First make sure that the Mercury is properly plugged in and you have confirmed that it's using the latest software - enabling fire fighting mode might disable older incompatible software.
2. Verify that the vedere vessel management software is up to date.  If it is not, it might end up disabling itself without your knowledge or consent.
3. Check if there are any third-party applications currently loading or running conflicts with the vedere vessel management software - stopping those applications may fix the issue.

How do i fix: adding a new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: adding a new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When you try to add or change a device or software definition in the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, the application will shut down. This seems to happen when the device is added to the application's configuration or list of detected devices. The problem can often be resolved by restarting the application.

Comment

There is a known issue with the Vedere Vessel Management Software application in which adding or editing devices causes it to crash. This issue can be resolved by restarting the application. We are currently working on a fix for this issue.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The software application, Vedere Vessel Management Software ('software'), is shutting down intermittently. Resetting the alarms Times Alerts Panel ('TAP') is not resolving the problem.

Comment

Hello!

Thank you for reaching out to us about your experience with the Vedere Vessel Management Software. We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with the software. Here are a few troubleshooting suggestions to help resolve the issue:

1. Make sure that all of your alarms are configured correctly in the Times Alerts Panel. The software may be shutting down intermittently because of mismatches between alarms and vessel status.


2. Try resetting the alarms panel by clicking on 'Reset All Alarms'. If this does not fix the issue, make sure that the power cord is securely plugged into the base station and that there are no broken or loose wires near the alarm panel. Additionally, try restarting the entire software system.

Alternatively, you can try downloading a different app that will allow you to zoom in and out more comfortably.

In order to fix this issue, either a manual disable or reset of the engines needs to be done.

Length:500

How do i fix: removing an old device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: removing an old device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Consider the following scenario: You have an older device installed on your computer, and you want to remove it in order to free up more space. Unfortunately, this action also causes the Vedere Vessel Management Software application to stop working.

There are a few possible solutions to fix this issue. First, you could try deleting the old device's registry entries. This would allow the software to continue functioning even without the old device present. Alternatively, you could try reinstalling the Vedere Vessel Management Software application from its original downloaded file. If either of these solutions fails, then you may need to contact customer support for help troubleshooting the issue.

Comment

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Vessel Management Software is installed on a computer and it is shutting down when a brand new device is installed.

Comment

It is possible that the Vessel Management Software is shutting down because the device is new, but it is also possible that the Vessel Management Software is shutting down because there is too many discrepancies between the older device and the new device. When discrepancies arise, it can be difficult for the Vessel Management Software to keep up with all of the new changes and keep everything running smoothly. In cases like these, it may be helpful to speak with a customer service representative from the software manufacturer in order to see if there are any solutions that can be made.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Problem:

The fire fighting mode in the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is shutting down the application.

Comment

Solution 1: Verify that there is a Fire suppression CAN connection currently established between the Vessel Management Software and the Command Control Node.
If not, then establish and verify a Fire suppression CAN connection.

Solution 2: Verify that the system time is correct and within acceptable deviation limits.

If the system time is out of tolerance, then synchronize it with an authoritative NTP server.

On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When using the Mercury conning display, I have found that it will often freeze up, preventing me from using the Vessel Management software application. I have Various fixes that I've tried, but none of them work consistently. Some of them work for a short time, but then the display will freeze up again. I'm not sure what is causing the problem, but I would really appreciate any help you can provide.

Comment

There could be a few reasons why the Mercury conning display may freeze up, but the most likely cause is improperly installed or defective hardware. If you are in possession of a mercury conning display that consistently freezes up, you may need to either replace the faulty component or have it repaired by a professional technician. In some cases, cleaning or lubricating the internals of the device may also resolve the issue.

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury / MerCruiser connection software is freezing up when I try to open the accompanying Vessel Management Software application. This problem has been going on for a few months now and I can't seem to find any possible solution online.

Comment

The problem could be one or more of the following:
- Your computer's hardware isn't up to speed - is your system sufficiently updated with the most recent drivers?
- The Mercury / MerCruiser connection software and accompanying Vessel Management Software application are suspects because of possible incompatibilities (for example, Microsoft Windows vs. Mercury / MerCruiser operating system versions, etc.).
- There may be insufficient or mismatched internet traffic between your computer and the Mercury / MerCruiser connection software or accompanying Vessel Management Software application.

createCase

Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury On Demand electronic service broadcasts packets to shared network devices attached to Mercury computers in order to populate or update their cache. One problem can be seen when adding a new device to the network. When the new device is added, Mercury sends a signal to the device asking it to "update its cache." However, this signal can freeze the Vedere Vessel Management Software application which prompted Microsoft support to recommend uninstalling and reinstalling the software. A fix suggested by Microsoft was to force close and open the VesselManagementConfig.xml file.

Comment

However, this workaround has the side effect of deleting any customizations that have been made to the file.

Solution: While Microsoft's workaround may temporarily fix the problem, it will inevitably cause unique troubleshooting issues for different users as they try to replicate and manually fix their settings. A better solution would be for Mercury On Demand to use Creeper or an automation utility to add new devices without sending a signal or interfering with Windows settings. This way, users would not have to worry about individual sets of customized settings getting lost due to software updates.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:reset the alarms
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is freezing the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When i try to zoom to a different screen on my mercury, the vedere vessel Management software application freezes.

Comment

Some tips to try if your Mercury Vieira Management (MVM) software application freezes when you try to zoom to another screen:
-Make sure that all of the screens in your MVM are set to their appropriate viewing sizes
-Try zooming into the area where you think the problem is, then scroll around until you see the part of the screen that has stopped working
-If still having trouble, try pressing CTRL + Z (Windows users) or CMD + Z (mac users), then clicking on OK in the window that pops up.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix configure the software is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix configure the software is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Hi there!


We've been encountering an issue with the Mercury Software freezing randomly when attempting to access the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. As far as we can tell, it seems to be related to configuration issues within the software. Unfortunately, we haven't been able to find a permanent solution aside from resetting all the parameters within the software. Is there any way that you could walk us through how you're experiencing this issue and/or provide us with any specific information that may help us identify the source of the problem? In terms of time frame, would it be acceptable for you to give us a few quick turnaround times? Thank you in advance for your help!

Comment





We've been encountering an issue with the Mercury Software freezing randomly when attempting to access the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. According to our testing, it seems the issue may be related to configuration issues within the software. Resetting all of the parameters within the software seems to have been successful in temporarily resolving the issue, but we would like more information regarding your specific experience in order to accurately diagnose and resolve the root cause of the problem. We appreciate your patience and discretion as we work to find a lasting solution. We hope to have an update for you within 3-4 business days

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Keyword:removing an old device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1

Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

One possible solution to this problem is moving the old device to a separate physical hard drive or USB flash drive and then disconnecting the old device from the Mercury. Alternatively, you can try reinstalling the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

PP: There is not a definitive approach to this problem, as VMS software needs the Mercury device controller in order to function. However, one possible solution is to try reinstalling the VMM software application, which may enable the Mercury device controller to function separately. Alternatively, you can move the old device to a separate physical hard drive or USB flash drive and then disconnect the old device from the Mercury.

How do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The conning display is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

Hello there! Thank you for reaching out to us regarding the freezing of the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. There could be a few possible causes for this, and we would be happy to help determine the root cause. Firstly, are you noting any errors or unexpected behavior when trying to use the software? If so, please let us know as we may be able to diagnose and fix the issue from there. Additionally, have you tried resetting all parameters in the software? This could potentially help clear out any obstructions or corruption from the previous session, and restart the application cleanly. In the event that these measures do not appear to resolve the underlying cause, then it might be necessary to troubleshoot and reinstall the software. If you need further assistance or advice, please do not hesitate to reach out again and we will do our best to help.

How do i fix: disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The engines are freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

This may be due to a few things. Dietrich tells customers that the freezing on any CPU or HDD may because of physical inactivity, oil build-up, improper cooling or bad cords。 There are a few easy ways how to solve this problem: -turn off unnecessary devices in the room (like televisions, air conditioning units, and other appliances) when using the software -keep the computer clean andcool -keep Li-ionbattery charged

How do i fix: configure the software is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: configure the software is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The software is freezing when trying to configure it.

Comment

There could be many possible causes of software freezing when trying to configure it, but one likely cause is incorrect or missing software updates. Make sure that you have the latest software and driver updates installed, as well as any necessary hotfixes. In some cases, basic system optimization can also help lessen the occurrence of software freezes, including disabling any unnecessary services and cleaning up PC hardware clutter. If all this fails to fix the issue, please reach out to technical support for further assistance.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: removing an old device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

EdgeCAM Removal When removing an old device from the video edgecam (Vedere Vessel Management Software [Verb 353]), the process freezes the application.

Comment

There could be a few things that are causing the issue.

One of the most common reasonsEdgeCAM Removal freezes is because it is not running in diagnostics mode. To run EdgeCAM in diagnostics mode, go to: File > Preferences (Command-O on a Mac), select the Environment tab, and check the box next to Run EdgeCAM indiagnostics mode.

If you're experiencing problems with your computer trying to launch EdgeCAM, there could be a bunch of steps you can take to try and troubleshoot and fix the issue. Check out our Knowledge Base article for more information on how to troubleshoot issues with your computer trying to open EdgeCAM: https://help.sonarproject.org/Edgecam/Troubleshooting-Opening-EdgeCam

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: installing a brand new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

When I try to install a new device the Vedere Vessel Management Software application tends to freeze.

Comment

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out about the installation of your new device. In general, freezing of the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is often caused by third-party applications being installed alongside of the Vedere vessel management software. If you are still experiencing freezes when trying to install or update your VA marine system, please bear in mind that there may be an issue with the third-party application. It is recommended that you uninstall these applications and test your installation once again. We apologize for any inconvenience this issue may have caused.

createCase

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software

Boat:Mercury

Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Vessel management software often freeze when in fire fighting mode. The application becomes nonresponsive and needs to be restarted for it to function again.

Comment

Fire fighting software often freeze when entering a fire scene. This is because the software is constantly trying to update critical data on the location of the fire, which can slow down and become nonresponsive in high-activity scenes. To workaround this issue, you may need to restart the application in fire fighting mode.

On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Hi,

In order to review certain vessel movements, the Mercury Legacy Surfacing System utilizes CCTV cameras at various points along the boat's rear. Unfortunately, I have noticed that these cameras frequently seem to disable themselves and a resetting of the Vedere Vessel Management Software application has proven to be unsuccessful in returning them to functionality. Can you offer any advice on how to fix this issue? Thank you!

Comment

EY suggested that youremove the power cable from each camera and touch a metal part on each camera to re-establish power.

If reprogramming doesn't work, I would Have them diagnosed and repaired.

Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Your Mercury has the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, which wards off potential problems caused by an alarm. Resetting the alarm, however, goes against this software's safety measures and can lead to dangerous outcomes.

To fully reset the alarm, perform the following steps:
-Press and hold ESCAPE and 2nd button until Vista Maximum begins blinking.
-Release ESCAPE button and 1st button at same time.
- depress 1st and 3rd buttons simultaneously (settings should now read General)
- while still holding 3rd button down release escape AND SETTINGS buttons
-continue holding settings button until Vista Maximum stops blinking.

Comment

createCase

Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The problem is that when you press the 'zoom to screen' button, the Mercury software automatically resets the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. This means that you can't zoom in or out of your vessel photos, charts and data by pressing the 'zoom to screen' button. You need to go into the Vessel Management Software and reset it.

Comment

The Mercury software automatically resets the Vedere Vessel Management Software application if you enter zoom-in or zoom-out mode. To avoid this problem, you need to go into the Vessel Management Software and reset it.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The Mercury problems stated: "On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application." This error might occur when you saved your work in progress and quit without resuming it. To solve this problem: Restart your computer. Then, open Mercury, do your work and save it. When you are finished, click on the Quit button (the red x at the top right of the window). Finally, restart Mercury.

Comment

On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

One of the Mercury's recent upgrades reset the Vessel Management Software application which prevented older devices from being formatted. The upgrade also caused some connectivity problems between the Mercury and domestic satellites. This problem can be fixed by restoring default settings in the Vessel Management Software application.

Comment

For the Mercury issue, restoring default settings should fix the problem. Mercury Control can also try to troubleshoot and resolve any connectivity issues.

How do i fix: enable the conning display is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the conning display is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The conning display is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. This issue occurs when you try to open the application and receive the following message: "The conning display has been reset, please try again later." The cause of this issue is unknown.

Comment

If the conning display is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, you may need to troubleshoot the issue. This can involve checking to see if there are any updates or software patches that need to be applied. Additionally, it may be helpful to check the system settings and make sure they are correct. Lastly, you may want to try restarting your computer in order to refresh any pending tasks or updates.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The stern CCTV has been intermittently disabling and resetting itself. The application will not stay up when scrolling through the capture frames.

Comment

The CCTV camera may be hampered by an obstructing object or peripheral equipment. As a result of this, the camera may experience intermittent power imbalances and unexpected restarts. To avoid these issues, please ensure that no external devices are obstructing the camera's line of sight or drawing excessive power from the network socket. In addition, try clearing your browser's cache and history, disabling programs that run in the background, and inspecting your router's logs for traceable activity.

createCaseComment

Product:Vedere Vessel Management Software
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

My Vedere Vessel Management Software alarm keeps resetting itself. I followed all the steps in "Reset or Disable an Alarm" and it still doesn't work.

Comment

There may be one of these possible problems, and fixing them will restore normal function to the alarm:

1) There may be an issue with the connected software or hardware. Log into the software and check all processses. Try starting from scratch by reinstalling the software. If that doesn't work, there might be a problem with the actual alarm module or its wiring. Contact your vendor for support.
I had this same issue Vallarta Solutions has a great customer service team
2) There could be a problem with your data encryption configuration. Be sure to follow all instructions in "Set Up Encrypted Data" if you're encrypting your data. It's possible that an incorrect password or encryption key was entered. Contact your administrator for help configuring encrypted data.

All of my products have very user friendly manuals as well plus they always email me help articles as they are updated so I am comfortable troubleshooting any of my products myself

How do i fix: adding a new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: adding a new device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

Vedere Vessel Management Software crashes when adding a new device.

Comment

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out to us about the issue you are experiencing with the Vessel Management Software. We would be happy to help troubleshoot this for you further and ascertain the cause of the issue. In regards to adding a new device, could you please let us know if this happens when trying to add a new device after already importing data or during initial setup? If it happens during initial setup, this may need to be fixed prior to adding new devices. Lastly, can you tell us what version of the software you are using and how long ago it was installed? From here we can attempt to pinpoint any specific issues with the software that may be causing the crash. Thank you for your patience and cooperation as we work to resolve this.

How do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: reset the alarms is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.

Symptoms

The problem may occur when the Vedere Vessel Management Software stops responding or closing too fast. To fix this issue, follow these steps:



1. Close the application by pressing Ok on the upper left corner of the app window.

2. Refresh the page in your browser (replace "http://vlime.vederecompany.com" with the URL of your desktop application) to ensure that your PC is connected to the INTERNET and viewable by Vedere Vessel Management Software. If not, make sure your PC is connected to the Internet, select OK from step one, enter VLIME in Step two of Google Chrome and click ENTER www.vederecompany.com as instructed. Once you are on the website 12815393-70df-4654-a868-75cdc0429c2f (replace -70df with 4654), press ESCAPE to close menu bar and right click on the window controlling article tick box which says “lock screen Windows” so you can grid start typing regedit copy startingRegistryKeyofHKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE startup Bohome int hk3 set b6Es expected value "Vanish 1" restart Windows


1. Find and open Windows registry file located at C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\. VirtualBox\Local Settings\Application Data\Vedere company\.reg 2. Paste following values below into empty text boxes and replace with name of particular application that stop responding or closing too quickly: LOCK="True" WAIT=5000<BR> 3. Press Save button. This seemed to be affecting any attempts to move around screens or perform other tasks. After a little investigation, we determined that this was due to a problem with how our software handled navigation Drift data. <BR>Since this problem affects how we use our software, it is difficult to remediate without completely reinstalling the program. <BR><BR>We are looking for a way to disable or fix this issue so that Zoom Control works as it should and users can successfully navigate around screens within the product.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">This issue is due to a problem with how the navigation data is being handled within our software. In this case, all associated vessels would revert to their original startup state. There are a few things that could trigger an inconsistency between the settings on the Vessel Management Software application and the values stored in Vedere Control Panel: 1) if settings (position, heading, speed, etc…) were changed directly on the Vessel Management Software application, but not saved in Vedere Control Panel; 2) if adjustments were made to settings that were automatically exported from Vedere Control Panel to the Vessel Management Software application, but not vice versa; or 3) if incorrect navigational database files have been uploaded to the Vessel Management Software application. Attempting to solve this problem by restoring defaults on the Vessel Management Software application and Vedere Control Panel might resolve the inconsistency issue, but it is also possible that user-generated data may be lost in this process. In this case, it may be necessary to recreate all of the vessel's historical data from scratch using either manual input or exporting historical records from Vedere Control Panel and importing them into the Vessel Management Software application.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>removing an old device</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: removing an old device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: removing an old device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: removing an old device is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Vedere Vessel Management Software application has stopped working correctly because an old device has been removed.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Hi, <BR><BR>Thank you for contacting us about the Vedere Vessel management software. We've investigated what might be causing the issue and have found a solution that should resolve it. Below is a step-by-step guide onhow can you install the application on a brand new device:<BR><BR><BR><BR>Completely erase any data on the freshly purchased device, including all files and apps Setup Vedere Vessel Management Software on a new device that's preferably tailored to portable or tablet usage Install** a clean copy of Windows 10 or macOS** v10.13 Mojave onto the newly acquired device Reboot the device Agree to allow Windows 10/macOS permissions when prompted Open Microsoft Edge or Safari and visit fidyanetworks.com Enter your username and password Click Sign In*** to launch the main application window If prompted, agree to let Skype use your phone's camera and microphone. The Vessel Tracking UI should now load If not, continue to the next step* Elsewhere in this article: Shut down Skype MacOS: Go to System Preferences then Privacypage, uncheck "Enable Voice Recognition" (if an icon is shown this step has been completed) Quit Skype PC from App Store: open App Store, choose Skype (in.)"then tap Quit</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the fire fighting mode</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: enable the fire fighting mode is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">There is a known issue where the fire fighting mode on the Vedere Vessel Management Software application gets reset randomly. This can causescripts to not work as intended and can lead to vessel malfunctions. There is currently no way to permanently fix this problem, but there are steps that individuals can take in order to minimize its effects. First, users should make sure that they are properlylogging into their account and adjusting their settings accordingly. Also, ensuring that all of the vessel’s alarms/warning lights are properly configured can help as well. Finally,user should update their Vedere Vessel Management Software application</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">as soon as possible in order to patch any known issues. <BR><BR>A known issue with the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is that it can randomly reset, causing scripts to not work as intended and leading to vessel malfunctions. To minimize its effects, users should make sure that they are logging in and adjusting their account settings as needed, as well as ensuring that all of the vessel’s alarms/warning lights are properly configured. Secondly, an update to the software is always recommended in order to patches any known issues.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the conning display</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Mercury car-computer has an enable the conning display problem. I have accessed the Vedere Vessel Management Software application to try and fix the problem but it keeps booting back to the normal operating system. I have tried rebooting my Mercury, turning on enable the conning display in my computer's control panel and even turing off my Mercury's removable storage device in order to clear any hidden files that may be causing the problem. But nothing seems to work. Can you help me fix this problem?</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">The problem may be associated with your computer's control panel. Try disabling the conning display and see if that resolves the issue. If not, try restarting your computer and see if that solves the problem. If neither of those solutions resolve the problem, your Mercury car-computer may require service.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the CCTV on the stern</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Mercury is having issues with the Yachtmaster Plus Deluxe vessel performance software preventing access to the CCTV function. Steps to correct the issue: 1. Close all applications on the computer, specifically Yachtmaster Plus Deluxe, if open. <BR>2. Boot Mercury into Safe Mode (F8 at boot). <BR>3. Navigate to C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\Yachtmaster Plus and delete everything including theCache and YachtmastersList folders. <BR>4. Shutdown Mercury and re-booting. <BR>5. Please note that in order for later steps to work accurately you will need to start Mercury with administrative privileges by right clicking on 'Mercury' and selecting Properties, Advanced System Settings, User Profiles, and then enable the correct profile (Administrator or User) . Reboot Mercury once finished. Steps to recover CCTV functionality: 1. Simply restarting Mercury should allow access to CCTV from within Yachtmaster Plus Deluxe without further changes needed.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment"></p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the alarm</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Mercury nav system fails to start the Vedere Vessel Management Software application even though it is in the "boot" mode. Following procedures from the Mercury Owner's Manual may help to resolve the issue: 1. Activate the VSM application by pressing and holding down the left arrow key when turning on your mercurynav system; <BR>2. If boot mode IE f hemeroomactive is displayed, release the left arrow key. <BR>3. Confirm "VSM Boot Error Certificate Not Found" message appears then press OK key <F5> three times firmly until screen switches off.<BR>4. Lite hold Num lock while repeatedly pressing reset button (powered off by leaving machine unattended)<BR>5. Release all keys when screen flashesgreen with message - MERCURY NAV SYSTEM RESTARTING --... please keep eye on clock and wait approx 10 min before starting any engine runs to allow sysupgrade to complete successfully (screen should go blank after approx 1593 seconds). If it does not reset within 3 mins or if re-starting fails, check grounds for power receptacle!!! If found OK power recvmt [sic] 4and try step 5 again."</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">1. Activate the VSM application by pressing and holding down the left arrow key when turning on your mercurynav system; <BR><BR><BR>2. If boot mode IE f hemeroomactive is displayed, release the left arrow key. <BR><BR><BR>3. Confirm "VSM Boot Error Certificate Not Found" message appears then press OK key <F5> three times firmly until screen switches off.<BR><BR><BR>4. Lite hold Num lock while repeatedly pressing reset button (powered off by leaving machine unattended)<BR><BR><BR>5. Release all keys when screen flashesgreen with message - MERCURY NAV SYSTEM RESTARTING --... please keep eye on clock and wait approx 10 min before starting any engine runs to allow sysupgrade to complete successfully (screen should go blank after approx 1593 seconds). If it does not reset within 3 mins or if re-starting fails, check grounds for power receptacle!!!</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>adding a new device</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">In order to add or manage devices in Mercury, the user first needs to load the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. However, on some systems this successfully boots but on others it does not and no further attempts to load the application produce any results. After some investigation, it appears that when running the application, the user's avrdude is not properly set up for programming the device. The fix is to manually set up avrdude before trying to run the software.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">If the problem is that no application will load, it is likely due to a missing or improper reference to a DLL file. Try reinstalling Mercury or integrating it with an application management system such as System Center Configuration Manager. If that does not work, create (or find) the missing file and copy it to the Mercury installation location.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>reset the alarms</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">Error verifying system authority domain controller: The specified domain controller is not functioning properly. As you probably know, this is a common issue that can occur when there is a problem with the boot sector on your hard drive. If possible, I would recommend that you take steps to reformat your hard drive and install the MercuryEngine software again. Thank you for contacting us and we apologize for any inconvenience this may be causing you.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the conning display</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: enable the conning display is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The conning display is not enabled when the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is being booted.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Hi!<BR><BR>One possible issue, and one that we are familiar with, is that the default conning display setting, which should be "shown when the vessel is first started up", does not get enabled when the Vedere Vessel Management Software application is booted. This can easily be fixed by following these steps:<BR><BR>1. From the Tools menu, select Options.<BR>2. Select Visual Settings and choose the Display tab.<BR>3.127 Change the value for "Showed when cursor is first on display" to Yes in order to have the conning display always shown when you open the application. This will ensure that it is always enabled even if it wasn't set as the default when your system was initialized.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the CCTV on the stern</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The display on the front of the stern is displaying CCTV videos even when Vedere Vessel Management Software is not installed. Limiting access to certain functions could hamper an individual's safety and inhibit their ability to take control of the vessel in an emergency. Additionally, disabling the CCTV may lead to other safety issues, such as theft or vandalism. Consequently, it may be best to leave the CCTV enabled unless there is a specific reason to disable it.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the alarm</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">When I try to enable the alarm my Mercury Odometer begins showing a 0 as the mileage rather than the actual numbers. It is beginning to disc problem and make it difficult for me to keep track of my miles driven.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">“Hello, <BR>After reading your Mercury Odometer began displaying an 0 for mileage when you activated the alarm, I believe you have a problem with your instrument. Mercury is known to have problems with odometers after a certain time period. My advice is to take it to a mechanic immediately and have it checked out. It could lead to other more serious problems if not taken care of right away. Have a great day!</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>adding a new device</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix adding a new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Mercury Navigation system keeps saying "Adding a new device is erasing preferences." To resolve this issue, please follow the instructions below: <BR><BR>1.Locate your car's service manual. <BR>2.Navigate to Appendix E – Instrument Panel Displays and Controls - Alarm and Security Systems Section. <BR>3. Under Activation, locate Reset Base Unit and set to ON. <BR>4. Scroll down to locate Reset Siren (if equipped) and set it to ON. <BR>5. Press the [RESET] button located on the base unit or Siren control panel. The message, "Activation successful," will appear on the Instrument Cluster Display (ICD).</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">If this does not resolve the issue, please contact your Mercury dealer for further assistance.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>zooming to a different screen</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">On my Mercury, when I click on the Zoom button in the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, it chooses the HVAC control panel instead of the desired screen. This error happens every time I try to zoom in or out. What can I do to fix this problem?</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">There is a possible fix for this problem. First, verify that the Mercury drivers are up-to-date and configured correctly. If the drivers are working correctly, it may be an issue with the Zoom function in Vedere Vessel Management Software. To fix this problem, you can try disabling the Zoom function in the software. Alternatively, you can try using another application to zoom in on the desired screen and then daisy chain (connect) Vedere Vessel Management Software to that application.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the engines</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">Your Mercury has an error with the Vedere Vessel Management Software. Follow these steps to fix it: <BR>1. restart your Mercury <BR>2. click edit on the main panel <BR>3. go to preferences and select vmm section <BR>4. set the startup type to manual or unlock and press save <BR>5. power off your Mercury and restart it by pressing the power button and holding it until you seethe mercury logo <BR>6. when prompted to enter your firmware password, type in your code and press enter</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">1. Restart your Mercury.<BR>2. Click edit on the main panel.<BR>3. Go to preferences and select vmm section. <BR>4. Set the startup type to manual or unlock and press save.<BR>5. Power off your Mercury and restart it by pressing the power button and holding it until you see the mercury logo.<BR>6. When prompted to enter your firmware password, type in your code and press enter.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>configure the software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix configure the software is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix configure the software is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix configure the software is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The software is erroring when trying to configure Vedere Vessel Management Software.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Hello!\015\012Are you trying to configure Vedere Vessel Management Software for the first time? This can be caused by one or more of the following: 1) Trying to install a program that is incompatible with the software; 2) Your computer's graphics chip not being able to handle the software; or 3) Virutal machine crashes. The alarm has no sound and sometimes goes off multiple times in a row.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">There can be multiple reasons why an alarm may be blinking on your Mercury. First, the alarm status may have been caught by our system while it was in error. This is typically caused by a software issue and will require manual intervention from our team. Second, there could be an actual alarm condition that must be addressed by the technician to ensure safe operation of your machine. Finally, the alarm may be displaying temporarily as part of normal Mercury diagnostic behavior. If this occurs, please follow the instructions below to reset the alarm and prevent it from again happening.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how can i reset an alarm for a device.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how can i reset an alarm for a device.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Vedere Vessel Management software on a Mercury can preserve alarms for devices. However, there may be times when you would like to reset an alarm for a device. The process to reset an alarm is different for each type of alarm. To reset an alarm on a temperature sensor, open the Vedere Vessel Management software and select the device from the list at the top of the screen. Click on the Edit [+] symbol to open the Settings for this device. Under Alarms, click on the Reset button next to the alarm you would like to reset.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment"></p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>how do i change the alarm boundaries</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD].</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].</td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how do i change the alarm boundaries.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Vevere Vessel Management Software invokes a Vessel Health Alarm within the Vessel Property Dialog. The alarm boundaries can be changed by selecting the "Boundaries" tab and then clicking on the "AWAY" circle shown in the figure below. This will zoom out and show all of the vessel alarms in the current boundary area. The boundary size can be adjusted by moving the slider (or entering a numeric value in both fields) as desired. After making your adjustments, click on the "Apply" button to commit your changes.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">The Vevere Vessel Management Software invokes a Vessel Health Alarm within the Vessel Property Dialog. The alarm boundaries can be changed by selecting the "Boundaries" tab and then clicking on the "AWAY" circle shown in the figure below. This will zoom out and show all of the vessel alarms in the current boundary area.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>how to reset the software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD].</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].</td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how to reset the software.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how to reset the software.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, how to reset the software.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">When using the product Vedere Vessel Management Software on my Mercury, I cannot reset the software.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Thank you for contacting our support team! This started occurring after I updated my graphics card drivers. Everything was working correctly before that update but now whenever I enable the conning display (by pressing F12), the application closes out. I'm not sure what else could be causing this issue, but I need help fixing it.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Essentially one potential issue could be that you updated your graphics card drivers after experiencing problems. If your computer was previously stable with graphics card drivers and now the conning display is not working correctly, then it's likely something changed with those new drivers that caused this problem. Checking to make sure all other programs are closed before you enable the conning display is another simple way to try and pinpoint the cause. Once you have determined the source of the issue, fixing it will require further research or troubleshooting.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the CCTV on the stern</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">When you turn on the CCTV on the stern of your Mercury, it is disabling the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing difficulties with the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, particularly as this appears to be impacting camera functionality.
