Firstly, is ensuring all devices are registered with the Management Software application? If not, the application may not recognise any new devices when they are added. Secondly, if adding a new device resulted in the Management Software application shutting down, there may be an issue with the device or connectivity. Thirdly, it is possible that periodic updates or security patches have been installed which the current version of the Management Software Application cannot accommodate. Fourthly, versions of Mercury older than 18.1 (the most recent release at time of writing) may not support adding certain devices, such as cellular equipment or fish trackers. It may be necessary to upgrade to a newer release in order to add these devices. Fifthly, please check that there are no firewall issues blocking the device from communicating with the Vessel's systems. Sixthly, please whitelist the vessel IP address in any routers used by the Vessel so that all devices connected directly thereto can access Vessel systems properly.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>reset the alarms</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">Vedere Vessel Management Software on Mercury shuts down and fails to reset alarms when a Vessel closes its corresponding Portal using the Quit Vessel button. Additionally, any queries entered into the Vedere Vessel Management Software application are not saved and do not come up when reopening the application.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Software application issues can be difficult to troubleshoot. However, if you experience crashes, lags or failing alarms when your Vessel is closed using the Quit Vessel button and attempted queries are not saved, it is likely that one of the following is occurring: <BR>-The Mercury Vessel Management Software is not up-to-date with the latest releases. <BR>-The Mercury Vessel Management Software is struggling to connect to your Vessel's Portal. <BR>-Your network connection may be unstable or insufficient for Mercury Vessel Management Software to function properly. To resolve these software issues, please check that your Mercury Vessel Management Software is up-to-date andtryconnectingtoyourVesselPortalagain. If this does not resolve the issue, you may need to consult with a support technician.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>zooming to a different screen</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">When trying to zoom in or out on the Mercury OS using the touch-screen, scrolling or if you hit the home button to close out of an application, the Zoom screen will come up with a “Zooming to another screen is shutting down Vedere Vessel Management Software: Do you want to continue?” situation. This problem can be resolved by following these steps:<BR><BR>1. Verify that you are shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application properly by attempting to exit out of it.<BR>2. Check to see if the device you are trying to remove is meeting the minimum Windows requirements by opening Device Manager and verifying that the device is listed. If it is not, you will need to update your software or purchase a new device that meets those requirements. If the device is listed and is not meeting the minimum Windows requirements, proceed to step 3.<BR>3. Disable CD/DVD random access by running this command: C:\\Windows\\System32\\drivers\\cdrom.sys This will prevent Windows from accessing any of your disks as if they were directories. Note that this will also disable autoplay for music and video files as well as crashes caused by sudden changes to disk access (for example, if you brake or lose your CD or DVD). This cannot be undone once disabled.<BR>4. Remove the device from your computer by Powering Off your computer, unplugging the device completely, and then pulling out the plug on the back of the computer. Be careful not to hit any cables connected to other devices in the area.<BR>5. Reattach the device and re-start your Mercury54 hardware initialization process by turning on both your computer and the Mercury54 and press Delete immediately after powering on both machines until you hear a standard startup noise from Mercury54 indicating that it has started up properly</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">.<BR>6. If mouse and keyboard do not work after step 4: Check that the device is receiving power by checking the power light. If it is blank or red, the device may not be getting power.<BR>7. Disable Enhanced Recovery ROM (ERR) Support by Running this Command: C:\\Windows\\System32\\cncsvc.exe <-- This is located in the Accessories section.<BR>8. Avoid removing devices while Mercury54 is in use or downloading new software or updates by pausing Mercury54's hardware initialization process after step 4.<BR>9. If you are still having problems: reinstall your computer operating system, install a new device that meets minimum requirements, or consult Mercury support for assistance."<BR><BR>The steps you must take to resolve this problem are as follows: <BR>1. Verify that you are properly shutting down Vedere Vessel Management Software by exiting out of it. <BR>2. Check to see if the device you are trying to remove meets the minimum Windows requirements by opening Device Manager and verifying that it is listed. If it does not, you may need to update your software or purchase a new device that meets those requirements. <BR>3. Disable CD/DVD random access by running this command: C:\\Windows\\System32\\drivers\\cdrom.sys This will prevent Windows from accessing any of your disks as if they were directories. Note that this will also disable autoplay for music and video files as well as crashes caused by sudden changes to disk access (for example, if you brake or lose your CD or DVD). This cannot be undone once disabled. <BR>4. Remove the device from your computer by Powering Off your computer, unplugging the device completely, and then pulling out the plug on the back of the computer. Be careful not to hit any cables connected to other devices in the area. <BR>5. Reattach the device and re-start your Mercury54 hardware initialization process by turning on both your computer and the Mercury54 and press Delete immediately after powering on both machines until you hear a standard startup noise from Mercury54 indicating that it has started up properly. <BR>6. If mouse and keyboard do not work after step 5, check that the device is receiving power by checking the power light. If it is blank or red, the device may not be getting power. <BR>7. Disable Enhanced Recovery ROM (ERR) Support by Running this Command: C</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>installing a brand new device</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix installing a brand new device is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">There is a brand new device installed on your Mercury that is causing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application to shut down. There is voltage present at the FireWire port, but the module will not power on. The warner was going to replace the firewire module, but now I'm not sure if that's necessary.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">This could be due to a number of things, but the most likely culprit would be a dead firewire port. Reinitialize the conning display. Options include restarting the computer, unplugging and replugging in the conning display, or rebooting the computer.<BR><BR>2. Attempt to fix the problem through Vedere Vessel Management Software. Check whether any error messages are displayed, and attempt to resolve them.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the CCTV on the stern</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The camera on the stern is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">There is a problem with the camera on the stern and it is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Researchers are Unable to Reset Alarm Originating from a Vessel, despite attempts to access this button and reload the software. Resetting alarms when the software shuts down may be required for vessel owners or operators that use Vedere Vessel Software for regulatory compliance. Re-enable the alarm reset button in the application</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">, and provide instructions on accessing this button.<BR><BR>The alarm reset button can be re-enabled in the application by following these steps: <BR>1. Navigate to Setup > Alarms <BR>2. Under Vessel Select, click on the name of the Vessel to open its detail window. <BR>3. Under Alarms on this Vessel, click on the alarm you wish to reset. <BR>4. Next to Alarm Reset Button Click Here (shown in Figure 1), click the Active checkbox to activate the button, and then click OK. The Reset Alarm hyperlink will now be visible within the details for this alarm (shown in Figure 2).<BR>5. Once you have re-enabled the reset button, please provide instructions on accessing it within the Vedere Vessel Software Application guide or on emailing techsupport@vedereeng.com<BR><BR>Figure 1: Re-enable the alarm reset button within Vedere Vessel Software</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>zooming to a different screen</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is shutting down the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The user is zooming in on a vessel on one screen and then trying to open the Vessel Management Software application on another screen. One possibility is that your console's power supply may be inadequate. If the freezing occurs when you try to change screens, then it may be because your console isn't receiving enough power. Try plugging the console into an outlet that's a bit stronger, or try replacing the power supply if needed. You can also check to see if any of the connectors on the console are plugged in incorrectly. If all else fails, you may need to service the console.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the engines</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is freezing the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Mercury OS freezes the Vedere Vessel Management Software application when displaying vessel data. lens -Frequent the camera whenever possible to ensure proper picture quality -Warm up the chamber affected by the frost before reinstalling the camera</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the adding a new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: adding a new device is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Vedere Vessel Management Software application is freezing on adding a new device. I have uninstalled and reinstalled the application, but the software still freezes when trying to add a new device.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">There could be a number of reasons why the Vedere Vessel Management software application might freeze when adding a new device. Some likely causes could include: incorrect input into thedevice addition form, poorly configured network connections, expired media or software licenses, or outdated device drivers. One possible solution could involve troubleshooting and/or resolving any issues that may be causing the software to freeze, before reinstalling the application.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>reset the alarms</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is freezing the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: reset the alarms is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: reset the alarms is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: reset the alarms is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">Resetting the alarms is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">If the problems persist despite attempting to reset alarms, it might be necessary to uninstall and reinstall the software in order for it to operate normally. In addition, if p OS X Lion got updated a few days ago with a new version of Qt 5 (5.7), then there is a decent chance your straining to zoom in caused by this (the Qt 5 update fixes memory leaks that sometimes plague zooming in applications->https://discuss.qt-project.org/index.php?topic=326844).tl;dr:<BR><BR>There may be several causes for an application freezing when zooming in, some of which can be fixed by updates to your graphics drivers and software, and others that may require reinstalling the application from scratch.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the engines</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is freezing the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: disable the engines is freezing the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Vedere Vessel Management Software application is freezing, sometimes disabling the engines. This issue can be difficult to resolving. Below are some Troubleshooting Steps that may help locate and fix the issue:<BR><BR><BR>1. Make sure that the computer has sufficient resources to run Vedere Vessel Management Software. To test if the computer has sufficient resources, try launching Vedere Vessel Management Software on a low-resource device, such as a mobile phone or a tablet. If the application launches and functions normally on a low-resource device, then the computer may also have sufficient resources to run Vedere Vessel Management Software.<BR><BR>2. Verify that the operating system preference settings for memory and CPU utilization are within recommended range. Operating system preference settings can be accessed through System Properties in Control Panel or System Administration Interface in Windows 8 or 10. System Properties can be accessed by clicking My Computer> Properties in Windows XP or by going to Start> Settings> Control Panel> System> Advanced Tab> Performance Options. In Windows 8 or 10, select Cpu usage graph from the under Columns heading in Performance Scheduler - Selecting an event sourced mode for Nirsoft's Process Monitor resource utilization report.(Process Monitor should already be installed on your computer if you are running Microsoft Window.)In Windows 7,System Performance > AMD Processors / Intel Processors set to English > Change keyboards input language: and set it to Sprechen nicht Deutsch (German) before selecting OK.]If Application startup time remains high, you may need to disable one of the devices on your computer that is used by Vedere Vessel Management Software: 1) Disconnect any other USB devices except for a keyboard, mouse and printer when initializing Vedere Vessel Management Software 2) If connected to Internet, disconnect any other external routers 3) Disable any other applications that may be hogging resources from Vedere Vessel Management Software Test whether Vedere Vessel Management software starts without any issues after following these steps</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">. If issues persist, review below Troubleshooting section.<BR><BR>3. Verify that the computer is connected to the proper network and Internet. Mulitple external displays may require a different wired or wireless network than the one used by your computer. Your computer must have an active Internet connection in order to successfully connect to Vedere Vessel Management Software.<BR><BR>4. This problem might be caused by numerous factors- ranging from a simple string of bad luck to complex technical issues with the system.<BR><BR>The first step is to try resetting the vessel management software. Unfortunately, this generally doesn't work- and often makes the problem worse. On someboats, if you power down the VMS and then power it back on again, it might work for a short period of time. But eventually, the camera will start working randomly again.<BR><BR>In extreme cases, where resetting the system doesn't work and则 continually failing to solve the issue, you may need to remove and replace one or more of the Mercury's computer boards. The exact course of action required depends on your specific boat model and configuration, but typically involves diagnostic and repair procedures specific to yourboat.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment"></p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the alarm</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the alarm is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Mercury vehicle management software application will reset when you enable the alarm. To reset the alarms: 1. Disconnect all of the car’s electrical accessories. This includes potentially all of the car’s lights (both inside and outside), radios, climate control and backup camera systems. 2. Reset each individual alarm using the following steps: a. Under the WARNINGS tab in the Property panel, select ALARMS from the listbox. b. Click on the DISMISS ALARM button to erase the alarm condition at that particular location. Once you've clicked on that button, an LAPD message should appear to inform you that "your alarm has been erased." Repeat this process for every alarm on your Mercury.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">If a light, radio or any other type of electrical accessory was connected to your car when the alerts were set and now you want to disable the alarm, disconnect that accessory before resetting the alarms.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management I replaced the speedometer on my car with a Bosch aftermarket unit and ever since then I have been having trouble installing new devices. The first time it happened I replaced my disk drive and everything went fine, however after that I have had to reset the vessel management software application on my Mercury multiple times. Whenever I try to install a new device the software detects that there is already a device installed and it prompts me to initialize or replace the device. Since I did not voluntarily replace my old device with a new one the software thinks there has been a malfunction and therefore repeatedly asks me to reset it. Now, every time I try to install new device or update an existing one on my Mercury all I get are error messages and eventually the software will force close altogether which prevents me from doing any sort of work on my car. Can somebody please help me figure out how to fix this?</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">.<BR><BR><BR><BR>Hello, I have had the same problem as you. My car would not let me install a new device it said there was an installing the device already which happened because I replaced my speedometer with a Bosch after market unit. After doing some research I found out that when you are trying to install a new device or update an existing one on your mercury all you get is"error message and eventually the software will force close altogether which prevents me from doing any sort of work on my car." To fix this you need to initialize your smart phone or erase the registry. Both of these can be done by following these steps:\015\012 1. Turn off your Mercury 2. Restart with the drivers' installation disc 3.When asked for CD press 3 4. From "Set up your Car" highlight "System > Initialize Vehicle Parameters." 5. Select Initialize 6. Follow screens 7. When prompted to Erase Flash Logo Advise "Yes" 8. Close program</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the fire fighting mode</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the fire fighting mode is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the fire fighting mode is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the fire fighting mode is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Mercury Firefighting Mode is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">The Mercury Firefighting Mode is a safety feature that is intended to reset the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. Check the button to see if it is properly in contact with the controller board, if it is touching another object then vibrations may be shoving the button out of contact. Double-check all power and communications lines between controller and alarm reset switch.Sometimes alarms get dislodged from their mounts, and will need a Jolt to momentarily re-establish contact and renew power. If none of these solutions work, then it might be time for a new alarm reset switch.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>zooming to a different screen</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">Zooming to a different screen is resetting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">We apologize for any inconvenience caused. This can help prevent automatic Resetting of the Vessel Management Software from Windows operations like removing a device.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Hi, <BR><BR>Resetting Vessel Management Software may be problematic on older operating systems. I'm having a really hard time trying to fix an issue where whenever I try to install a new device on my Mercury SimoneTech Storage Area Network (ASA), the Vedere Vessel Management Software application keeps freezing on me and won't let me do anything else. The installation window pops up, but then just dies and I have to restart the computer. Below is a more in-depth description of what's going on. I hope someone can help me out! <BR> asa: Vendor: ^Boot status: ^Error code 1 Error condition: Power off <Device> service failed to start or power resume device Failure Reason ------------<BR>Services that require simultaneous on- AND off Power Administration activity in order to function properly (note verbose output here): Autopilot DAQ station, BMC device, SES Web Service Pubsub Queue (version 3), Emerson MyData Server for StreamC libraries service.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">This is likely caused by a power reset during device installation and requires manual intervention to correct. Action ------------<BR>If coming from command line: <BR><STRONG>mdconfig</STRONG>: In order to correct this issue, you'll need to force the ASA device to power off properly. To do so, use the following command.<BR> mdconfig --as ahd input=00:02:03:00:… outlettype equals "Internal" stop bit 1 ieee80211n disable stop ahdlps disable Exit Without Saving:# cab disassociate raid1 UUID from ahda0<BR><BR>First and foremost, it seems that your Mercury SimoneTech Storage Area Network (ASA) might be crashing or not working correctly because of an installation problem with one of the devices attached to it. Unfortunately, we can't do anything to help you fix the installation issue on your end - that falls under the control of your computer's operating system. However, there are some things you can do in order to try and resolve the ongoing crashing and freezing issues you're experiencing with Vedere Vessel Management Software.<BR><BR>First, make sure that the devices attached to your ASA are plugged into the power source and properly configured with their driver software. If the devices are recognized and are properly configured, then there's a good chance that something else is causing the installation problems on your system. The first thing you can try is restarting your computer - if crashes or freezes become less frequent after restarting your computer, then that could be a sign that something smaller is causing the issue and can be fixed without requiring a full system reboot. You can also upgrade your computer's operating system version to see if that resolves any installation or crash issues. Finally, if upgrading your OS does not resolve problems, it might be necessary to contact Viet Tan Technologies Support for assistance troubleshooting the specific type of installation issue you're having.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>reset the alarms</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The reset alarm function on the Mercury CERES data storage server appears to have stopped working. Wright Networks is recommending that users reset alarms using the management software application, Vedere Vessel Management Software. This will create a PDF backup that includes all of the stores on the data storage server.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>zooming to a different screen</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix zooming to a different screen is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">When attempting to zoom into the Vessel Management Software application from within the Mercury Operating System, the application will not activate and automatiosly reboot. What can I do to fix this?</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">There might be a more recent version of Mercury Client software on your computer, so you should check the software center to see if an update is available. If you cannot find an update,you can try to install the Mercury Client from the CD or Digital Download that came with your computer. Youcan also go to MercuryClient.com and download the latest version of Mercury Client.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>removing an old device</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">I've tried briefing my problem to several people, but no one can seem to offer me a solution. I have a 2003 Mercury Sable with the 2.5i engine. I recently replaced the timing belt, water pump, and other essential fluids in the engine, but when I tried to restart the car, the dashboard listed my Mercury DVD player as a disconnected device. I couldn't remove it because the car would not start. I had to do a forcedshutdown in order to boot into Windows 2000 so that I could remove the DRM-locked player from the system. Now that the original software is no longer supported by Mercury (it's from 2009), how am I supposed to upgrade or uninstall it?</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">There is no one answer to this problem, as the best solution will vary depending on your car and situation. In some cases, third-party software that can uninstall older DVD players or upgrade their firmware may be available. In others, it may be necessary to remove the DRM encryption from the player in order to install a newer version. If your car 'won't restart' due to the need to remove a newer DVD player from the system, it may be worth reaching out to a dealership or mechanic for support.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>installing a brand new class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the fire fighting mode is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">On my Mercury, when I try to enable the fire fighting mode, the application boot errors out. The error message is "The command or operation required to enable the fire fighting mode could not be completed because of an active virus protection program."Any help would be appreciated.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Since your Mercury is infected with a virus, firefighting mode might not be enabled correctly. Try following these simple steps: 1) Press the F1 key to get to the main menu. 2) click on " settings ." 3) Click on " security ." 4) Click on " Sophos . Anti-Virus ." 5) Click on " settings." 6) Highlight "Fire fighting" in the left pane and change its value from "enabled" to "disabled." 7) Click on Ok to save your changes.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the conning To fix this, Bootstrapping The Software Application using Alternate Boot Medium such as CD or USB.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>adding a new device</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: adding a new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: adding a new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: adding a new device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">When a new device is added to the system, the Vedere Vessel Management Software application (VVMS) will not start up. There are several potential causes for this problem and depending on the specific situation, one or more of the below solutions may be applicable:<BR><BR>1) Missing dependencies: verify that all required dependencies for VVMS are present on the system and that they are installed in the correct order. If any of the required dependencies is missing, VVMS will not start up.<BR><BR>2) Corruption of the VVMS configuration file: if the VVMS configuration file is corrupted, it will not be possible to start VVMS. To verify if this is the case, try accessing the VVMS administrator interface from another user account and see if it loads correctly. If it does not, there is a high probability that the configuration file is corrupted and you will need to restore it from a backup.<BR><BR>3) Incorrect user permissions: if a user does not have rights to access and use VVMS, it will not be possible to start up VVMS when a new device is added. Check the user accounts in Active Directory for any users who lack permissions to administer devices in Active Directory and change their permissions accordingly.<BR><BR>4) Device drivers not loaded: if appropriate device drivers are not installed on the system, they will not be able to talk to the new device and VVMS will not start up. Verify that all required device drivers are installed on the system and locate them in properly registered directories. If they are not located properly, you may need to get them from a third-party source or install them using an administrative software installation tool such as WindowsInstaller 3.1.<BR><BR>5) Incorrectly configured removable storage media: if removable storage media that contains data crucial for running VVMS cannot be accessed either because it is missing or has been removed from the system completely, then VVMS will not start up. Try reinstalling the operating system if necessary to repair or replace the removable storage media.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Alternatively, you can move the data necessary for VVMS to a network location.<BR><BR>6) Corrupted files in a device: if a device is corrupt and infected with a virus, it will not be possible to access files on the device and VVMS will not start up. If the device is physically damaged, part of the filesystem may be severely corrupted and this will also prevent VVMS from starting up. In situations like these, it may be necessary to reformat the entire disk drive.<BR><BR>7) invalid configuration file settings: if some settings in the VVMS configuration file are invalid, this will prevent VVMS from starting up. Check the entry for "device type" in the config file to make sure that the correct device driver has been selected and that the correct path to the driver file has been specified.<BR><BR>8) Insufficient memory: if the system is running low on memory, VVMS may not start up even if all of its requisite requirements are present. Check system resources closely to see whether any additional resources (such as more RAM or faster processors) may be required to support VVMS.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>reset the alarms</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: reset the alarms is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Vedere Vessel Management Software application is sporadically crashing when trying to reset the alarms shortly after startup.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">As long as the alarm reset cycles are short (<2 minutes) and you have latest software, there is no noticeable issue. Alarm reset frequency may need to be increased if longer reset cycles are observed or if equipment failure is suspected.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>zooming to a different screen</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: zooming to a different screen is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">Vedere Vessel Management Software is booting when users try to zoom in or out of a particular screen. If you are experiencing this issue and are unable to fix it, please contact support for help.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the engines</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: disable the engines is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Vedere Vessel Management Software application is not functioning. I have tried using a older configuration file that I previously used but it still fails to start the application.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Usually, when an application fails to start due to bad configuration files, it is because the file format has changed since the application was last configured - which could happen if you upgraded from a previous version of the application or if the software package was replaced by a new version. In this case, it may be helpful to attempt to rebuild the software package from source using the exact same configuration files that were used before (or a preserved backup). If this fails, then it may be necessary to contact the software vendor for support in restoring compatibility with their applications.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>removing an old device</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: removing an old device is booting the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The old device is getting in the way of the Vedere Vessel Management Software application and it needs to be removed.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Thank you for reaching out. The fire fighting mode has been enabled and prompts the user to enter their credentials. However, the fire fighting mode is not always enabled and when it is, it boots the application rather than the default outlook screen. This problem can be remedied by disabling the fire fighting mode when it is not necessary.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Fire fighting mode is a tool that Vedere Vessel Management Software utilizes to help manage white-box deployments. When it's enabled, the application boots immediately to deal with fires. However, as mentioned above, fire fighting mode is not always enabled, so it can conflict with the default boot path. In these cases, disabling fire fighting mode would fix the issue and restore the default boot path.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the conning display</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the conning display is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the conning display is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the conning display is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The Mercurya vehicular computer system errors when attempting to activate the conning display. In order to fix this problem, you will need to uninstall the software and reinstall it again. To do so, first clear all the data by Erasing all user data. Next restart your computer,.Delete existing registries located C:\Program Files (x86)\Mercury Computer System, then install Mercury VMS from DVD using the following instructions:<BR><BR>1. Close any programs that are open presently.<BR>2. Insert the Mercury VMS DVD into your optical drive if it's not already there<BR>3. Click on "Setup." Then click "On computers." After clicking on "On Computers," select your computer from the list and click on "Next."<BR>4. Click on "Install Mercury Software." Then follow the on-screen instructions to get started!</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the CCTV on the stern</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">On my Mercury, when trying to disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application, I get a message reading "The propulsion system input or output channels are in use".</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">This is likely indicative of camera interference. First, the device could be damaged and not bootable anymore. If this is the case, you might be able to recover data from the device by recovering its backup or reformatting it. If the device is a physical machine that was swapped out by another user and cannot be found anywhere, you might have to contact the original user to get information about where it is and obtain permission to delete it. Finally, if your institution's IT department hasn't set up removals for old devices yet, it might be a challenge to find and access the device.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>installing a brand new device</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix installing a brand new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix installing a brand new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix installing a brand new device is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">A new device is sometimes failing to install due to errors in the Vedere Vessel Management Software application. There are various tips that you can try to fix this problem. Some of the fixes include repairing or reinstalling the application, clearing your computer's cache and files, and troubleshooting issues with your network connection.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Some common Vedere Vessel Management Software application errors include missing files, invalid scans, and damaged databases. Here are some tips to try if your device is having trouble installing:<BR><BR>1. Repair or reinstall the application: If the problem is something related to the software itself, reinstalling it may fix it. If the issue is with your computer or network, you will need to seek help from those resources.<BR><BR>2. Clear your computer's cache and files: This sometimes clears any errors that are preventing the installation from completing.<BR><BR>3. Troubleshoot issues with your network connection: If you have specific questions about how to troubleshoot your network connection, please contact our support team at 1-800-244-4701.<BR><BR>If none of these solutions work, please reach out to our help desk at 1-800-244-4701 and we would be happy to help you troubleshoot your device.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>enable the fire fighting mode</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the fire fighting mode is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the fire fighting mode is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the fire fighting mode is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">The mercury is having trouble fixing the enable fire fighting mode error.</p><h3>Comment</h3><p class="comment">Your Mercury device may need to be reset. We are aware of the issue and are working to resolve it as quickly as possible. In the meantime, we recommend following these instructions: <BR><BR>Enabling the conning display in Vedere Vessel Management Software<BR><BR><BR>1. Access the Vessel Screen in Vedere Vessel Management Software. <BR>2. Click on the Display Settings tab at the top of the screen. <BR>3. Select Enable Conning Display from the drop-down box andclick OK. <BR>4. If the error message displays again stating "Enable the conning display is erroring", make sure that your computer is connected to the internet, that Vedere Vessel Management Software is properly installed, and that you have restarted your computer.</p><HR><h2>createCase</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Keyword:</td><td>disable the CCTV on the stern</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Title Sentence:</td><td>How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.</td></tr><tr><td>Problem Sentence:</td><td>Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT]. </td></tr><tr><td>Symptoms Sentence:</td><td>Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h2>createCaseComment</h2><table><tr><td>Product:</td><td>Vedere Vessel Management Software</td></tr><tr><td>Boat:</td><td>Mercury</td></tr><tr><td>Version:</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>Temp:</td><td>1.2</td></tr><tr><td>Length:</td><td>500</td></tr></table><hr><h1>How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</h1><h4>For model: Mercury</h4><p class="version">Installed version: 1</p><h3>Problem</h3><p class="problem">How do i fix: disable the CCTV on the stern is erroring the Vedere Vessel Management Software application.</p><hr><h3>Symptoms</h3><p class="symptoms">As described in the CBS White Paper: CCTV on Vessels Increases Safety, we have updated our software to be Vedere-compliant. To troubleshoot the issue, follow these steps: Check if there are any new hardware or software installations recently. Uninstall any unknown applications and drivers recently installed. Check for a weak battery and replace it if necessary. Clean the computer's sensitive area, such as CPU and RAM sockets, with compressed air and a Vacuum cleaner. Disable hard disk defragmentation and back up all important data before proceeding. Make sure that your system meets all prerequisites listed in the Install Vedere Vessel Management Software application documentation.
